olisipo: <entryFree id="n32488" type="main" key="O^li^si_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlĭsīpo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlysippo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ulys-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lusitania</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Lisbon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olysippo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: Ulysippo, Mela, 3, 1, 6.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlĭsīpōnensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Olys-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Olisipo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promontorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 113</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlĭsīpōnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Olisipo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Olisiponians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 5, 4, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olitor: <entryFree id="n32489" type="main" key="o^li^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĭtor</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏlĭtor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>holus</etym>, <sense id="n32489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kitchen-gardener</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cabbage-gardener</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 20</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:229" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:2" default="NO">11, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olitorius: <entryFree id="n32490" type="main" key="o^li^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlĭtōrĭus</orth> (or, better, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏlĭtōrĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>olitor</etym>, <sense id="n32490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a kitchengardener</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to vegetables</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum olitorium erat antiquum, macellum, ubi olerum copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=146" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 146</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <trans><tr>the green-market</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostiola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 64</bibl></cit> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:198" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oliva: <entryFree id="n32491" type="main" key="o^li_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e)lai/a</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n32491.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An olive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:4" default="NO">2, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 90</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 478, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecta de pinguissimis Oliva ramis arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:56" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olea duarum vel trium olivarum in summitate rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 17, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32491.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an olive-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristaeus, qui olivae inventor dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erum an bacis opulentet olivae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam fallens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivus Olivarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the Mount of Olives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 15, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons Olivarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Zach. 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32491.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n32491.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An olive-branch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique decerptam fronti praeponere olivam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32491.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A staff of olive-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an olive-staff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 681</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olivans: <entryFree id="n32492" type="main" key="o^li_vans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> as <sense id="n32492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> [oliva], <hi rend="ital">an olive-gatherer</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 3, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olivarius: <entryFree id="n32493" type="main" key="o^li_va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to olives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">olive-</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only post-class. for olearius): olivariae metretae (al. oleariae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oliveta: <entryFree id="n32494" type="gloss" key="o^li_ve_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvēta</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the olive-harvest</hi>: olivetam dicebant ab oleis ut a vino vindemiam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=192" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 192</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">olivitam antiqui dicebant, quom olea cogebantur ... quamvis quidam olivitatem eam dicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 202 Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
olivetum: <entryFree id="n32495" type="main" key="o^li_ve_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place planted with olive-trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an olive-grove</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quo pluris sint nostra oliveta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineta, segetes, oliveta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 86</bibl></cit>; <pb n="1263" /> <cb n="OLOR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:1" default="NO">5, 9, 1</bibl> sq.: veteris proverbii meminisse convenit, eum qui aret olivetum, rogare fructum; qui stercoret, exorare; <cit><quote lang="la">qui caedat, cogere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to plant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Fragm. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineta et oliveta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, Mons Oliveti, <hi rend="ital">the mountain of Olivet</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">of the olive-grove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east of Jerusalem</hi> (= mons Olivarum, v. oliva), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olivifer: <entryFree id="n32496" type="main" key="o^li_vi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oliva-fero</etym>, <sense id="n32496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">olive-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Mutuscae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva, i. e. Sabina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:151" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>of olive-branches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:99:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 99, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurotas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:227" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 227</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olivitas: <entryFree id="n32497" type="main" key="o^li_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oliva</etym>, <sense id="n32497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the olive-gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">olive-harvest</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 148, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:15" default="NO">12, 50, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:52" default="NO">52</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">largissimis olivitatibus exuberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. oliveta.</sense></entryFree>
olivitor: <entryFree id="n32498" type="main" key="o^li_vi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who plants and tends olive-trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an olive-dresser</hi> (postclass. for olitor): <cit><quote lang="la">colles exercentur vinitori et olivitori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl></cit> (App. Flor. n. 15 dub.; al. olitori).</sense></entryFree>
olivo: <entryFree id="n32499" type="main" key="o^li_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. olivans.</entryFree>
olivum: <entryFree id="n32500" type="main" key="o^li_vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlīvom</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n32500.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32500.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Oil</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose for oleum): <cit><quote lang="la">eme die caecā hercle olivum, id vendito oculatā die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1073" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1073</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inolens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 850</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfundere pisces olivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex olivis meis olivum feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:79" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32500.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the palœstra</hi> (from the use of oil to anoint wrestlers): <cit><quote lang="la">cur olivum vitat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. oleum.—</sense><sense id="n32500.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unguent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrio fragrans olivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6</bibl></cit>. 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:16:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 16, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olla: <entryFree id="n32501" type="main" key="olla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">aula</orth>: <sense id="n32501.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">aulas antiqui dicebant, quas nos dicimus ollas, quia nullam litteram geminabant. Itaque aulicocia exta, quae in ollis coquebantur, dicebant, id est elixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl></cit> Müll.—Examples with aula, for olla, are found in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 52, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 44</bibl>; 47; 4, 2, 4; 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 66</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2473</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3001</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4537</bibl> sqq.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 543, 8</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root uk-, Sanscr. ukha, pot; aula for aukula</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a pot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrilibrem aulam onustam auro habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 543, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ollam denariorum implere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monendus qui vasa emturus est, ne bibulas aut male coctas emat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 43, 11</bibl></cit>: ET OLLAS PRECATI SVNT, Inscr. Fratr. Arv. tab. 41 a; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Marini Atti, p. 593: grandes fumabant pultibus ollae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:171" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 171</bibl></cit>.—For preserving the ashes of the dead, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 865, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4544</bibl>; Jahn, Specim. Epigr. p. 29 sq.—Prov.: olla male fervet, <hi rend="ital">the pot boils poorly</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the affair looks bad</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38, 13</bibl>: ipsa holera olla legit, <hi rend="ital">the pot culls its own herbs</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">serves itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:94:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 94, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus redigentur in ollam,</quote> <trans><tr>made as black as a pot</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32501.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">olla cujus rubigo in eā est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the city full of the vile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 24, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ollaris: <entryFree id="n32502" type="main" key="olla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ollāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>olla</etym>, <sense id="n32502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a pot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserved in pots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potted</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">uvae ollares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ollarium: <entryFree id="n32503" type="gloss" key="olla_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ollārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. ollarius, II.</entryFree>
ollarius: <entryFree id="n32504" type="main" key="olla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ollārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>olla</etym>, <sense id="n32504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pot-</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ fusor,</quote> <trans><tr>a pot-founder</tr>, <tr>pot caster</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 630, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32504.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">ollārĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the receptacle for the jars of ashes in tombs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 13</bibl>, n. 60; cf. Fabr. p. 10 sq.</sense></entryFree>
olle: <entryFree id="n32505" type="gloss" key="olle"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olle</orth>, <itype>old form for ille</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
ollicula: <entryFree id="n32506" type="main" key="olli^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ollĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>olla</etym>, <sense id="n32506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pot</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ollicula aerea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ollula: <entryFree id="n32507" type="main" key="ollu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ollŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pot</hi> (anteand post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ollulā cinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ollus: <entryFree id="n32508" type="main" key="ollus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ollus</orth>, <itype>a, um, old form for ille</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
olma: <entryFree id="n32509" type="main" key="olma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> ebulum, <hi rend="ital">among the Dacians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olo: <entryFree id="n32510" type="main" key="o^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. oleo <sense id="n32510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ololygon: <entryFree id="n32511" type="greek" key="o^lo^ly^gon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlŏlygon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)lolugw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n32511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the croaking of the male frog</hi>, to attract the female, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olor: <entryFree id="n32512" type="main" key="o^lor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in <cb n="OLYM" /> post-Aug. prose for cygnus): <cit><quote lang="la">ad vada Maeandri concinit albus olor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arguti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:102" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">olorum morte narratur flebilis cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32513" type="main" key="o^lor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>olo, oleo</etym>, <sense id="n32513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odor</hi> (only ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">litterā commutatā dicitur odor olor, hinc olet et odorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 83</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">olore spurcissimi umoris perfusus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 110, 2</bibl></cit> dub.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 85</bibl> (al. odores).</sense></entryFree>
olorifer: <entryFree id="n32514" type="main" key="o^lo_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. olor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n32514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swan-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Padus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. ad Ser. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olorinus: <entryFree id="n32515" type="main" key="o^lo_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlōrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. olor</etym>, <sense id="n32515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a swan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swans</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 718</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>white</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 163</bibl></cit> (al. orobini): <cit><quote lang="la">OLORINO DE IOVE,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the form of a swan</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 99, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olostrae: <entryFree id="n32516" type="main" key="O^lostrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlostrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 249</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olus: <entryFree id="n32517" type="main" key="o^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlus</orth>, v. holus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32518" type="gloss" key="Olus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Olus</orth>, <itype>i, another form for Aulus</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1943</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2712</bibl>; cf. olipor.</entryFree>
olvatum: <entryFree id="n32519" type="gloss" key="olva_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">olvātum</orth> <itype>Antistius Labeo ait esse mensurae genus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll.; v. Müll. s. v.</entryFree>
olybrius: <entryFree id="n32520" type="main" key="O^ly_brius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlȳbrius</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōlybrius</orth>, Anth. 2, p. 287), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the surname of several Roman consuls.</hi> To one of them, the consul Anicius Olybrius, is addressed a poem of Claudian. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olȳbrĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Olybrian</hi>: genus et nomen, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:556" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 556</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olympeni: <entryFree id="n32521" type="main" key="O^lympe_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city of Olympus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Lycia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri Olympenorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olympia: <entryFree id="n32522" type="main" key="O^lympi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭa</orth> (anciently <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlimpus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlumpus</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpia</foreign>, <sense id="n32522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacred region in</hi> Elis Pisatis, <hi rend="ital">with an olive wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the Olympian games were held; there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were the famous temple and statue of</hi> Juppiter Olympius: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Olympiam venisset, maximā illā quinquennali celebritate ludorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum uno die duo suos filios victores Olympiae vidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32522.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpiakos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Olympic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami, i. e. oleaster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:554" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 614</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32522.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlym-pĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Olympic</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32522.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Olympicūm for Olympicarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 23</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Olympic</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:3" default="NO">13, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32522.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Olympic</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <trans><tr>the Olympic games</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubrum Olympii Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 14</bibl>. There was also a temple of Juppiter Olympius in Athens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in Syracuse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equa,</quote> <trans><tr>that had run in the Olympic races</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 181</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32522.5" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n32522.6" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an appellation bestowed on distinguished men by the Greeks and Romans;</hi> of Pericles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 10, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> on coins, also of the Roman emperors, Hadrian and Commodus, Eckhel. D. N. t. 6, p. 518.—</sense><sense id="n32522.7" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the temple of the Olympic Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 33, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32522.8" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympia</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *)olu/mpia</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">i(era/</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the Olympic games held every four years at Olympia</hi>: sic ut fortis equus, spatio qui saepe supremo Vicit Olympia, <hi rend="ital">in the Olympic games</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)olu/mpia nika=n</foreign>), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl> (Ann. v. 442 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad Olympia proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 70, 144</bibl></cit>: magna coronari Olympia (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)olu/mpia ta\ mega/la</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. to the games held elsewhere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympiorum solenne ludicrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympiorum victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>the victory in the Olympic games</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32522.9" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpia/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an Olympiad</hi>, the period of four years that elapsed between the Olympic games, and which the Greeks usually employed in the computation of time: centum et octo annis, postquam Lycurgus leges<cb n="OLYN" />  scribere instituit, prima posita est Olympias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Roma condita est secundo anno Olympiadis septumae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 15, 28: ante primam Olympiadem condita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextā Olympiade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—In the poets sometimes for lustrum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a period of five years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquennis Olympias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter senas vidit Olympiadas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:40:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 40, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32522.10" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpiei=on</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a temple of the Olympic Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olympiades: <entryFree id="n32523" type="main" key="O^lympi^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. Olympus, I. B.</entryFree>
olympias: <entryFree id="n32524" type="main" key="O^lympi^as1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Olympia, E.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32525" type="main" key="O^lympi^as2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Neoptolemus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consort of king Philip of Macedon and mother of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32526" type="main" key="O^lympi^as3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a north-west wind</hi>, that blows on the island of Eubœa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:232" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 24, 37, § 232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olympicus: <entryFree id="n32527" type="main" key="O^lympi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Olympia, C.</entryFree>
olympieum: <entryFree id="n32528" type="main" key="O^lympi^e_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Olympia, F.</entryFree>
olympio: <entryFree id="n32529" type="main" key="Olympi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Olympĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a character in</hi> Plaut. Cas.</sense></entryFree>
olympiodorus: <entryFree id="n32530" type="main" key="O^lympio^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympiŏdōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpio/dwros</foreign>, <sense id="n32530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name.</hi> So <hi rend="ital">the instructor of Epaminondas on the flute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olympionices: <entryFree id="n32531" type="main" key="O^lympi^o^ni_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭŏnīces</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)olumpioni/khs</foreign>, <sense id="n32531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a victor at the Olympic games</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atyanas pugil, Olympionices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 13, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympionicarum equarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olympiscus: <entryFree id="n32532" type="main" key="O^lympiscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Olympio</etym>, <sense id="n32532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a caressing form for</hi> Olympio: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympisce mi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
olympius: <entryFree id="n32533" type="main" key="O^lympi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Olympia, D.</entryFree>
olympus: <entryFree id="n32534" type="main" key="O^lympus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-pos</orth> (anciently written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olĭmpus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/olumpos</foreign>. <sense id="n32534.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several mountains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most celebrated of which is one on the borders of Macedonia and Thessaly</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Lacha</hi>), <hi rend="ital">of great height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and consequently regarded as the seat of the gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:4:8:15" default="NO">4, 8, 15</bibl>: Musae quae pedibus magnum pulsatis Olimpum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 20</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">his diis Helicona atque Olympon attribuerunt homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes excedit Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 271</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32534.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">heaven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum dicunt Graeci Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longus Olympus,</quote> <trans><tr>the distant heavens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuit (Juppiter) et totum nutu tremefecit Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stelliger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1907" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1907</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympĭădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi> (perh. only acc. to the foll. remark): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum dicunt Graeci Olympum montem in Macedoniā omnes, a quo potius puto Musas dictas Olympiadas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32534.2" n="II" level="1"> Of other mountains. </sense><sense id="n32534.3" n="A" level="2"> In Bithynia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32534.4" n="B" level="2"> In Mysia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32534.5" n="C" level="2"> In Galatia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 20, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32534.6" n="D" level="2"> In Lycia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32534.7" n="E" level="2"> In Ionia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 118</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32534.8" n="F" level="1"> In Peloponnesus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 352</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32535" type="main" key="O^lympus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named from a neighboring mountain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the ruins of Deliktash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympum cepit, urbem antiquam et omnibus rebus auctam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 56</bibl></cit> (Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32535.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Lycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named from a neighboring mountain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 21, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32536" type="main" key="O^lympus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlympus</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous fluteplayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pupil of Marsyas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 393</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 165" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
olynthus: <entryFree id="n32537" type="main" key="O^lynthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlynthus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/olunqos</foreign>, <sense id="n32537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Macedonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Agia Maria</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Aio Mamas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 47</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32537.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olynthius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Olynthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Olynthian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 19</bibl>. —<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n32537.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olynthĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the region about Olynthus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32537.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olynthius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Olynthian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:10:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 10, 34</bibl>.—Usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Olyn-thii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Olynthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Olynthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:6" default="NO">7, 4, 6</bibl>. <pb n="1264" /> <cb n="OMIN" /></sense></entryFree>
olyra: <entryFree id="n32538" type="greek" key="o^ly_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏlȳra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/lura</foreign>, <sense id="n32538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> arinca, <hi rend="ital">which greatly resembles spelt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 20</bibl>. § 92; 22, 25, 57, § 121.</sense></entryFree>
olysippo: <entryFree id="n32539" type="main" key="O^ly^sippo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏlysippo</orth>, v. Olisipo.</entryFree>
omana: <entryFree id="n32540" type="main" key="Oma_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Omāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 149</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Omānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omasum: <entryFree id="n32541" type="foreign" key="o^ma_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏmāsum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏmassum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gallic; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr></etym>, <sense id="n32541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bullock's tripe</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): omasum <foreign lang="greek">bo/eion ko/peon liparo\n th=| tw=n *ta/llwn glw/tth|</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">patinas cenabat omasi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 180</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingui tentus omaso,</quote> <trans><tr>with his fat paunch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ombria: <entryFree id="n32542" type="greek" key="ombri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ombrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)mbria</foreign>, <sense id="n32542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omen: <entryFree id="n32543" type="main" key="o_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmen</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">osmen</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>omen quod ex ore primum elatum est, osmen dictum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 76</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">osmen, e quo s extritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, § 97: omen velut oremen, quod fit ore augurium, quod non avibus aliove modo fit, Fest. p 195 Müll.; perh. orig. osmen, for ausmen; root audio, that which is heard; hence, in gen.</etym>. <sense id="n32543.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, any indication or action regarded as a foreboding, <hi rend="ital">a foreboding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognostic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omen</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prodigium): di te deaeque omnes faxint cum istoc omine,</quote> <trans><tr>with your forebodings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum deorum voces Pythagoraei observaverunt, sed etiam hominum, quae vocant omina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45</bibl></cit>. 102: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae divina testimonia vocant, ex responsis, oraculis, ominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: mi pater, inquit (filiola L. Pauli), Persa (catellus) periit. Tum ille Accipio, inquit, mea filia, omen, <hi rend="ital">I take it as a good omen</hi> (of a victory over king Perses), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens omen magni triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui discedens mecum ita locutus est, ut ejus oratio omen fati videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus Antonius (o di immortales, avertite et detestamini, quaeso hoc omen!) urbem se divisurum esse promisit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hoc quidem detestabile omen avertat Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 40, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exire malis ominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (rem) tu ipse ominibus optimis prosequeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: cum bonis ominibus incipere, Liv. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">i secundo omine,</quote> <trans><tr>go in God's name</tr>, <tr>good luck attend you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impios parrae recinentis omen Ducat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Mater juvenem) Votis, ominibus et precibus vocat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod di prius omen in ipsum convertant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod acceperunt pro omine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:20:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 20, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32543.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32543.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A solemn assurance. condition.</hi> eā lege atque omine, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 29</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32543.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A solemn usage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic sceptra accipere et primos attollere fasces Regibus omen erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32543.4" n="C" level="2"> Prima omina = nuptiae, <hi rend="ital">as accompanied with auspices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 346</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Contineant nobis omina prima fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 24</bibl></cit> (4, 20, 14 M.).</sense></entryFree>
omentatus: <entryFree id="n32544" type="main" key="o_menta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omentum</etym>, <sense id="n32544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filled with</hi> omentum (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">isicia omentata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omentum: <entryFree id="n32545" type="main" key="o_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fat-skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adipose membrane; fat</hi>, esp. in men (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n32545.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32545.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ast illi tremat omento popa venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:74" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32545.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32545.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The membrane which encloses the bowels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the caul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 80, § 204</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32545.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The bowels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:47" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13</bibl></cit>. 116.—</sense><sense id="n32545.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any skin which envelops an internal part of the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a membrane</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the meninges</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ominalis: <entryFree id="n32546" type="spur" key="o_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, a false read. for inominalem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></entryFree>
ominatio: <entryFree id="n32547" type="hapax" key="o_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ominor</etym>, <sense id="n32547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foreboding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognostic</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ominator: <entryFree id="n32548" type="hapax" key="o_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diviner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omino: <entryFree id="n32549" type="main" key="o_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. ominor <sense id="n32549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ominor: <entryFree id="n32550" type="main" key="o_mi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (ante-class. <sense id="n32550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭno</orth>, āre: ut tibi bene sit, qui ominas, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 11</bibl>) [omen], <hi rend="ital">to forebode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognosticate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to augur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: divino, auguro, auspicor, vaticinor): malo (alienae) quam nostrae (rei publicae), ominari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius, quaeso, ominare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:329" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 329</bibl></cit>: felix faustumque <cb n="OMNI" /> imperium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac prope certā spe ominatos esse homines finem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 22, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera de exitu Antonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:71:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 71, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optamus tibi ominamurque in proximum annum consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor militum et sibi adversa, et Galbae prospera ominantium,</quote> <trans><tr>wishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">naves cum commeatu rediere, velut ominatae ad praedam alteram repetendam sese venisse,</quote> <trans><tr>as if they had divined</tr>, <tr>had had a presentiment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 31, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male ominatis Parcite verbis,</quote> <trans><tr>words of evil omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ominose: <entryFree id="n32551" type="main" key="o_mi^no_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭnōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ominosus <sense id="n32551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ominosus: <entryFree id="n32552" type="main" key="o_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omen</etym>, <sense id="n32552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of foreboding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portentous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ominous</hi> (post-Aug.): mons avibus obscenis ominosus, Messala ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:14:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 14, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14, 11</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmĭnōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ominously</hi>: ominose retentus, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omissio: <entryFree id="n32553" type="main" key="o^missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>omitto</etym>, <sense id="n32553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an omitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omission</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:48" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:10:62" default="NO">10, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omissus: <entryFree id="n32554" type="main" key="o^missus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from omitto.</entryFree>
omitto: <entryFree id="n32555" type="main" key="o^mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏmitto</orth>, <itype>īsi, issum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-mitto</etym>, <sense id="n32555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to let go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let fall.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32555.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; perh. not in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amitto, dimitto): aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <trans><tr>to let go</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans><tr>to let fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up the ghost</tr>, <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32555.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32555.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to lay aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dismiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disregard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omittere tristitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to leave unpunished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nostrae nobis utilitates omittendae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omitte timorem,</quote> <trans><tr>lay aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus omissis his rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>laying aside all those things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primam navigationem ne omiseris,</quote> <trans><tr>do not neglect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneo quam optabam occasionem neque omittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducum officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:9:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32555.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32555.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say nothing of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi>, in speaking (cf., relinquo, praetereo): <cit><quote lang="la">ut omittam cetera quae sunt innumerabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:266" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 266</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alia omittam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 22, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omitto illa vetera, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabiles viros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de reditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 24, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32555.6" n="2" level="3"> Of an action, <hi rend="ital">to leave off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi> doing any thing (syn. desino).—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>. rogare, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 90</bibl>: lugere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:266" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 266</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remiss</hi> (ante-class.): animo esse omisso, Ter, Heaut. 5, 2, 9.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab re Omissior,</quote> <trans><tr>in respect of property</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ommento: <entryFree id="n32556" type="main" key="ommento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ommento</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n32556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wait</hi> anywhere, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=190" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 190</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omentat, exspectat, dictum a mantando, id est diu manendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 492</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omnicanus: <entryFree id="n32557" type="hapax" key="omni^ca^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭcănus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n32557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [omniscano], <hi rend="ital">that sings everything</hi> or <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 349, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omnicarpus: <entryFree id="n32558" type="hapax" key="omni^carpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭcarpus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omniscarpo</etym>, <sense id="n32558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that crops everything</hi>: capra carpa, a quo scriptum Omnicarpae caprae, Varr L. L. 5, § 97 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
omniciens: <entryFree id="n32559" type="main" key="omni^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> <etym>omnis-cieo</etym>, <sense id="n32559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-stirring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all-exciting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:942" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 942</bibl></cit> Bern. (dub.; Munro, omnituentes).</sense></entryFree>
omnicolor: <entryFree id="n32560" type="main" key="omni^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-color</etym>, <sense id="n32560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of all colors</hi> (post-class.): pictura, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 12, 39.</sense></entryFree>
omnicreans: <entryFree id="n32561" type="main" key="omni^cre^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭcrĕans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> <etym>omnis-creo</etym>, <sense id="n32561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">allcreating</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 11:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 11, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
omnifariam: <entryFree id="n32562" type="main" key="omni^fa^ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭfărĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. omnifarius <sense id="n32562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
omnifarius: <entryFree id="n32563" type="main" key="omni^fa^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭfărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis</etym>, <sense id="n32563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of all sorts.</hi>—As <pos>adj.</pos> only in the gloss: omnifarius, <foreign lang="greek">pantoi=os</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 16</bibl>, read omnifariam).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭfărĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on every hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every way</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Oceanus omnes terras omnifariam et undiqueversum circumfluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omnifer: <entryFree id="n32564" type="hapax" key="omni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-fero</etym>, <cb n="OMNI" /> <sense id="n32564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all-sustaining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omnifluentia: <entryFree id="n32565" type="main" key="omniflu^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omniflŭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>omnis-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n32565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superfluity of all things</hi>, Placid. ap. Auct. Class. 3, p. 118 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
omniformis: <entryFree id="n32566" type="main" key="omni^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-forma</etym>, <sense id="n32566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of all shapes</hi> (post-class.): mundus receptaculum omniformium specierum, App. Trism. pp. 78, 98: machina, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 339.</sense></entryFree>
omnigenus: <entryFree id="n32567" type="main" key="omni^ge^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-genus</etym>, <sense id="n32567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of all kinds</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">omnigenūmque deūm monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnigenūm genitor deūm,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 912</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6, 1</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 759</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:821 al" default="NO" valid="yes">821 al.</bibl> Lachm. reads omne genus).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32568" type="main" key="omni^ge^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnisgigno</etym>, <sense id="n32568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-begetting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all-producing</hi> (postclass.): Pater, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omnimedens: <entryFree id="n32569" type="main" key="omni^me^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭmĕdens</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-medeor</etym>, <sense id="n32569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-healing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omnimodis: <entryFree id="n32570" type="main" key="omni^mo^di_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭmŏdīs</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n32570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in every way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fully</hi> (= omnibus modis; cf.: multimodis, mirimodis; <cit><quote lang="la">only Lucretian and late Lat.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 683</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:489" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 489</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:700" default="NO" valid="yes">700</bibl>; 3, 406; 5, 718; 1024; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 342, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omnimodo: <entryFree id="n32571" type="main" key="omni^mo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭmŏdo</orth> (also written separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">omnī mŏdo</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>omnis-modus</etym>, <sense id="n32571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in all ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">evitemus omnimodo, ne deliberasse videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnimodo res ea desperationem habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
