omnimodus: <entryFree id="n32572" type="main" key="omni^mo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭmŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of all sorts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kinds</hi> (post-class.). <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306</bibl>. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">voculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 5, p. 169, 35</bibl></cit>: gloria ejus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:66:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 66, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omnimorbia: <entryFree id="n32573" type="main" key="omni^morbi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭmorbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n32573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [omnis-morbus]. <hi rend="ital">all-disease</hi>, the name of a plant regarded as a panacea: <cit><quote lang="la">polion a Graecis, a Latinis omnimorbia, quod multis morbis subveniat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omnino: <entryFree id="n32574" type="main" key="omni_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnīno</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>omnis</etym>. <sense id="n32574.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at all</hi> (syn.: prorsus, penitus): Neoptolemus apud Ennium philosophari sibi ait necesse esse, sed paucis: nam omnino haud placere, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; v. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 156</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 417" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 417</bibl> Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non omnino jam perii: est reliquom quo peream magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionum laboribus aut omnino aut magnā ex parte liberatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non multum aut nihil omnino Graecis cederetur,</quote> <trans><tr>not at all</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit ut omnino nemo esse possit beatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id agimus ut id in sapiente nullum sit omnino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodium sanxisse, ut vix aut omnino non posset ... infirmari sua lex,</quote> <trans><tr>not at all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnino quidem, sed magnam partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae aut omnino aut certe facilius consequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos omittamus, qui omnino nusquam reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas omnino numquam attigerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 55</bibl></cit>: non usquam id quidem dicit omnino, sed quae dicit idem valent, <hi rend="ital">absolutely</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">expressly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explicitly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino, quod cupis, efficies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:98:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 98, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen omnino Teucros delere paratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne faciam, inquis, Omnino versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil omnino, te recitante placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:45:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 45, 4</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">omnis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego omnino lucrum omne esse utile homini existimo,</quote> <trans><tr>all and every</tr>, <tr>of all kinds whatever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus et cetera necessaria et omnino omnis argumentatio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:46:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 46, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis et injuria et omnino omne. quod obfuturum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 53, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin omnino interierint omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; v. also the foll.—With <hi rend="ital">prorsus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non justa, injusta, prorsus omnino obsequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32574.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32574.2" n="A" level="2"> With numerals, <hi rend="ital">in all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi> (= <foreign lang="greek">oi( pa/ntes</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">quinque omnino fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diebus omnino decem et octo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane frequentes fuimus: omnino ad ducentos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant omnino itinera duo,</quote> <trans><tr>there were only two ways</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae omnino civitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnino non essent amplius centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditionem unam omnino suscepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel omnino eam viderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1265" /> <cb n="OMNI" /> 24.—</sense><sense id="n32574.3" n="B" level="2"> In concessive clauses, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure.</hi> —With <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">restricti omnino esse nullo modo debemus, sed in deligendis idoneis judicium et diligentiam adhibere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">danda opera est omnino ... sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 71</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas omnino, sed cum adversario facili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 84</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">autem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino est amans sui virtus ... ego autem non de virtute nunc loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32574.4" n="C" level="2"> In making a statement of general application, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hominum genere, aut omnino de animalium loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimumque poëtis nostris, omninoque Latinis litteris luminis attulisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 4, 3</bibl>.—At the beginning of a general proposition: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino fortis animus et magnus duabus rebus maxime cernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino omnium horum vitiorum atque incommodorum una cautio est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32574.5" n="D" level="2"> After <hi rend="ital">non modo</hi> (non), in a climax: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo imperator, sed liber habendus omnino non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo tantam causam perorare, sed omnino verbum facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego non modo reges appellatos, sed omnino natos nesciebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 13, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omninominis: <entryFree id="n32575" type="main" key="omni^no_mi^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭnōmĭnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-nomen</etym>, <sense id="n32575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of every name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc vero innominem vel potius omninominem, siquidem sit unus et omnia, ut sit necesse aut omnia esse ejus nomine aut ipsum omnium nominibus nuncupari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Ascl. 20, p. 303</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omniparens: <entryFree id="n32576" type="main" key="omni^pa^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭpărens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-parens</etym>, <sense id="n32576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all-producing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose); so, <cit><quote lang="la">per terras omniparentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 595</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea Syria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 213, 9 (but in <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mund. p. 67, 12</bibl>, the correct read. is omnia parentis).</sense></entryFree>
omnipater: <entryFree id="n32577" type="main" key="omni^pa^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭpăter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>omnis-pater</etym>, <sense id="n32577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the universal father</hi> (postclass.): Deus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 70.</sense></entryFree>
omnipavus: <entryFree id="n32578" type="main" key="omni^pa^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭpăvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-paveo</etym>, <sense id="n32578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-fearing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">panphobi, quos nos omnipavos dicere poterimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:12:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 12, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omniperitus: <entryFree id="n32579" type="hapax" key="omni^pe^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭpĕrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnisperitus</etym>, <sense id="n32579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilled in all things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all-skilful</hi>: Aeetis sucis omniperita suis, Albinov. 2, 110.</sense></entryFree>
omnipollens: <entryFree id="n32580" type="main" key="omni^pollens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭpollens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-polleo</etym>, <sense id="n32580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almighty</hi> (post-class.): Deus, Prud. Apoth. praef. 31.</sense></entryFree>
omnipotens: <entryFree id="n32581" type="main" key="omni^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-potens</etym>, <sense id="n32581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omnipotent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 111, 15</bibl> (Trag. v. 202 Vahl.): Juppiter, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 254</bibl> (Ann. v. 446 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 154</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcuit omnipotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 505</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">annuit omnipotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:816" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 816</bibl></cit>: Neptunus, Turp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Juno</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:81" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si ideo omnipotens Pater, qui Filium habet, omnipotentior ergo esse potuit, si plures haberet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fide, 4, 8, § 85</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus ille omnipotentissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 4</bibl>: creator, id. Civ. Dei, 21, 9.—Very freq. in eccl. Lat., with Dominus, Deus, etc.; and as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Omnĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Almighty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Omnipotens nomen ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: nec Omnipotens subvertet judicium, id. Job, 34, 12.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">om-nĭpŏtenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">almightily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omnipotently</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
omnipotentia: <entryFree id="n32582" type="main" key="omni^po^tenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭpŏtentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>omnipotens</etym>, <sense id="n32582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">almighty power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omnipotence</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omnis: <entryFree id="n32583" type="main" key="omni^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (omnia is freq. a dissyl. in the poets, as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1106</bibl> Lachm.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin to ambo and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/</foreign></etym> (syn.: cunctus, universus), <sense id="n32583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum, quas ad beate vivendum sapientia comparaverit, nihil esse majus amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego nulli omnium neque populorum neque regum ... non ausim me comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo omnium imperatorum, qui vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 34, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: cur, si cuiquam novo civi potuerit adimi civitas, non omnibus antiquissimis civibus possit, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even of the oldest families</hi>, Cic. <cb n="OMNI" /> Caecin. 35, 101: <cit><quote lang="la">id effugiet qui non omnia minima repetet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Part. Or. 17:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 17, 60</bibl></cit>.—Cf. with <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnium tibi auxilia adjungas, etiam infimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: omnibus tuis etiam minimis commodis, Treb. Pol. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 44, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero ad omnes etiam minimos Circenses commeabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>.—But with <hi rend="ital">summa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extrema</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">ultima</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> omnia is often closely connected in a distributive sense (= quidquid summum, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">a te, qui nobis omnia summa tribuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed is omnia summa sperans aedilicius est mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:28:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 28, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituit extrema omnia experiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnia ultima pati quam se regi tradere maluissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes omnium ordinum homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus precibus petere contendit,</quote> <trans><tr>with prayers of every kind</tr>, <tr>most urgently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—Esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32583.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">omnes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">all men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all persons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est omnium, qui? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus ex omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 99</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonum omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorum, nisi qui inter tumultum effugerunt, omnes interficiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 32, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 31, 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ut omnes Tarquiniae gentis exules essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Hernici nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 42, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32583.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">all things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium nomine quicumque ludos faciunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to do every thing</tr>, <tr>make every exertion</tr>, <tr>spare no pains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: omnia fore prius arbitratus sum, quam, etc., <hi rend="ital">I should have believed any thing rather than that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11, 5</bibl>: omnia mihi sunt cum aliquo, <hi rend="ital">I agree with him on all topics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in all points</hi> (but mihi omnia communia sunt is the better read., Baiter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo sunt omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>every thing depends on that</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae sunt ad vivendum necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quaecumque agimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse omnia alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to be one's all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrius iis unus omnia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>in all points</tr>, <tr>in every thing</tr>, <tr>in every respect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir alioqui per omnia laudabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebes omnia quam bellum malebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 26, 82</bibl>: eadem omnia, <hi rend="ital">just the same</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi certum est efficere in me omnia eadem, quae tu in te faxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: alia omnia, <hi rend="ital">just the contrary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te alia omnia, quam quae velis, agere, moleste ferrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. alius, 6: omnia, adverbially, <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every respect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tramites, omnia plani et ex facili mobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 25:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia Mercurio similis,</quote> <trans><tr>in all respects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 558</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32583.3" n="II" level="1"> In <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">every</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the whole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militat omnis amans,</quote> <trans><tr>every lover</tr>, <tr>all lovers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: quia sine omni malitiā'st, <hi rend="ital">without any</hi> (colloq. for sine ullā), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sine omni periclo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: ne sine omni quidem sapientiā,</quote> <trans><tr>not without all knowledge</tr>, <tr>a complete philosophy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis honestas manet a partibus quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia ad omnem laudem, et publice, et privatim, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>every kind of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra plena omnis fortunae publicae privataeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenare holus omne,</quote> <trans><tr>every kind of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia est omnis divisa in partes tres,</quote> <trans><tr>the whole of Gallia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis insula est in circuitu vicies centena millia passuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus intenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem suum omnem profundere,</quote> <trans><tr>every drop of</tr>, <tr>all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis in hoc sum,</quote> <trans><tr>I am wholly engaged in this</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">plur. verb</hi>: omnis Graecia decoravere, etc., Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">omne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">every thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos autem, ab omni quod abhorret ab oculorum auriumque adprobatione, fugiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:128 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 128 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">omnīno</orth>, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
omniscius: <entryFree id="n32584" type="main" key="omnisci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omniscĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-scio</etym>, <sense id="n32584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">omniscient</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Spec. 16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Spec. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omnisonus: <entryFree id="n32585" type="main" key="omni^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-sono</etym>, <sense id="n32585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uttering all kinds of sounds</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">harmonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 24, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 912</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omnitenens: <entryFree id="n32586" type="main" key="omni^te^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭtĕnens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-tenens</etym>, <cb n="ONER" /> <sense id="n32586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">holding all things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all-swaying</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 5, 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omnituens: <entryFree id="n32587" type="main" key="omni^tu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭtŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-tueor</etym>, <sense id="n32587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-seeing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:942" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 942</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:247" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 247</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mundo, p. 71, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omnivagus: <entryFree id="n32588" type="main" key="omni^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-vagus</etym>, <sense id="n32588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roving everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omnivagant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Atac. in Anth. Lat. 2, p. 337" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Atac. in Anth. Lat. 2, p. 337</bibl> Burm. dub. (al. omnivomus).</sense></entryFree>
omnivolus: <entryFree id="n32589" type="hapax" key="omni^vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-volo</etym>, <sense id="n32589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">willing every thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnivoli furta Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omnivorus: <entryFree id="n32590" type="hapax" key="omni^vo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omnĭvŏrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>omnis-voro</etym>, <sense id="n32590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all-devouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omnivorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
omophagia: <entryFree id="n32591" type="greek" key="o_mo^pha^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōmŏphăgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">w)mofagi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the eating of raw flesh</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omphacium: <entryFree id="n32592" type="greek" key="ompha^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omphăcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)mfa/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n32592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the oil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">juice of unripe olives</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grapes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 27, 60, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:98" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 16, 18, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
omphacocarpos: <entryFree id="n32593" type="greek" key="ompha^co^carpos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omphăcŏcarpos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)mfako/karpos</foreign>, <sense id="n32593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> aparine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 15, § 32</bibl> (al. omphalocarpon).</sense></entryFree>
omphacomel: <entryFree id="n32594" type="main" key="ompha^co^mel"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omphăcŏmel</orth>, <itype>mellis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)mfako/meli</foreign>, <sense id="n32594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sirup made of</hi> omphacium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
omphale: <entryFree id="n32595" type="main" key="Ompha^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Omphălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)omfa/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n32595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a queen of Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom Hercules served</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 32" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:305" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 305</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:646" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 646</bibl>; cf. Preller's Gr. Mythol. 2, p. 158.</sense></entryFree>
omphalocarpos: <entryFree id="n32596" type="main" key="ompha^lo^carpos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omphălŏcarpos</orth>, v. omphacocarpos.</entryFree>
omphalos: <entryFree id="n32597" type="main" key="ompha^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">omphălos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)mfalo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the navel</hi> (pure Lat. umbilicus); transf. for <hi rend="ital">the centre</hi> (in post-class. poetry), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onager: <entryFree id="n32598" type="greek" key="o^na^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnăger</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnā^grus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/nagros</foreign>, <sense id="n32598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild ass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcher,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:100:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 100, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:103:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 103, 11</bibl>; id. Osee, 8, 9.—</sense><sense id="n32598.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a military engine for discharging large stones</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onagos: <entryFree id="n32599" type="main" key="o^na_gos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnāgos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/nagos</foreign>, <sense id="n32599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ass-driver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onchesmites: <entryFree id="n32600" type="main" key="Onchesmi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Onchesmītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ogxhsmi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n32600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wind blowing from Onchesmus</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*)ogxhsmo/s</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a harbor of Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onchestius: <entryFree id="n32601" type="main" key="Onchesti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Onchestĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n32601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Onchestus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 605</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onchestus: <entryFree id="n32602" type="main" key="Onchestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Onchestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Bœotia;</hi> v. Onchestius.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32603" type="main" key="Onchestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Onchestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onco: <entryFree id="n32604" type="main" key="onco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">onco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n32604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bray</hi>, like an ass: oncat asellus, Auct. Carm. Philom. 55.</sense></entryFree>
oncoma: <entryFree id="n32605" type="greek" key="onco_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oncōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/gkwma</foreign>, <sense id="n32605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tumor</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onear: <entryFree id="n32606" type="main" key="o^ne_ar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnēar</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">o)/neiar</foreign>, refreshment</etym>, <sense id="n32606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the same with the</hi> onotheras, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 69, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onerarius: <entryFree id="n32607" type="main" key="o^ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>onus</etym>, <sense id="n32607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transport</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">carriage; that bears a burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carries freight</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <trans><tr>beasts of burden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 4</bibl></cit>: navis, <hi rend="ital">a ship of burden</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 536, 5</bibl> (opp. actuaria); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 11, 6</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ship of burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a merchant-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a transport</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oneratus: <entryFree id="n32608" type="main" key="o^ne^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from onero.</entryFree>
onero: <entryFree id="n32609" type="main" key="o^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>onus</etym>. <sense id="n32609.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freight</hi> with any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n32609.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">navim magnam multis mercibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves, ad celeritatem onerandi subductionesque, paulo facit humiliores,</quote> <trans><tr>for loading expeditiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves commeatu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 86:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 86, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">costas aselli pomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri cervix oneratur aratro,</quote> <trans><tr>is loaded</tr>, <tr>burdened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures lapillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">umerum pallio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <trans><tr>to load</tr>, <tr>fill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. Rep. Ord. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. Rep. Ord. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulis onerari,</quote> <trans><tr>to overload</tr>, <tr>gorge one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino et epulis onerati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus, qui in aegritudine alat neque oneret,</quote> <trans><tr>without oppressing the stomach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccas,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause them to be covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32609.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dapibus mensas onerare,</quote> <trans><tr>to cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manusque ambas jaculis oneravit acutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:868" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 868</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculo palmas oneravit acuto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>armed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 574</bibl></cit> (but armavit is the better read.; v. Forbig. ad loc.): membra <pb n="1266" /> <cb n="ONOB" /> sepulcro, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 558</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa aggere terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem saxis,</quote> <trans><tr>to stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32609.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weary; to oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overload</hi> (with good or evil; cf. Forbig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 620</bibl>), etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">me amoenitate oneravit dies,</quote> <trans><tr>has overwhelmed me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā senem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignitateomnis mortalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem commoditatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem mendaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem argumentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera votis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis lassas onerantibus aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit>; for which only <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Sejanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4</bibl>. 68: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe praemiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32609.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make heavier</hi> or <hi rend="ital">more burdensome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render more oppressive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aggravate</hi> (only since the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Tac. and the younger Plin.): injuriam alicujus invidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectum avaritiā et luxu,</quote> <trans><tr>to aggravate</tr>, <tr>make worse</tr>, <tr>render more odious</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerat te quaesturae tuae famā, quam ex Bithyniā optimam revexisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 24, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:24:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:73:6" default="NO" valid="yes">73, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32609.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stow</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">heap up</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">in</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vina cadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canistris Dona Cereris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 180</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">filled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: oneratus frugum et floris Liberi, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 498, 12</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 95 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n32609.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Loaded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deceived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befooled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille est oneratus recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum probe jam oneratum huc admovebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
onerose: <entryFree id="n32610" type="main" key="o^ne^ro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕrōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. onerosus <sense id="n32610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
onerositas: <entryFree id="n32611" type="main" key="o^ne^ro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>onerosus</etym>, <sense id="n32611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burdensomeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onerosus: <entryFree id="n32612" type="main" key="o^ne^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>onus</etym>, <sense id="n32612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burdensome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressive</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; syn.: gravis, difficilis). </sense><sense id="n32612.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 384</bibl></cit>.—Of food that is difficult of digestion and causes oppression: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus etiam valentibus onerosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 62, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ervum) capiti et stomacho onerosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 73, § 153</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër est onerosior igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 53</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32612.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">burdensome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irksome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerosior altera sors est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sit onerosum succedere bono principi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 44, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consolatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnĕrōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">odiously</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerosius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Anim. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
onesicritus: <entryFree id="n32613" type="main" key="O^ne_si^cri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnēsĭcrĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)onhsi/kritos</foreign>, <sense id="n32613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an historian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Ægina; he was the chief pilot</hi> (praefectus classis) <hi rend="ital">of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:10" default="NO">10, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onesimus: <entryFree id="n32614" type="gloss" key="O^ne_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)onhsimos, -h</foreign>, <sense id="n32614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 646, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Grut.</author> 883, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onesiphorus: <entryFree id="n32616" type="gloss" key="O^ne_si^pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnēsĭphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)onhsi/foros</foreign>, <sense id="n32616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Inscr Maff. Mus. Ver. 286, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 477, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">269, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onesitrophus: <entryFree id="n32618" type="gloss" key="O^ne_sitrophus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnēsitrophus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Inscr Fabr p. 84, n. 144.</sense></entryFree>
onirocrites: <entryFree id="n32619" type="greek" key="o^ni_rocri^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnīrocrĭtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)neirokri/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n32619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interpreter of dreams</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oniros: <entryFree id="n32620" type="main" key="o^ni_ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnīros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/neiros</foreign> (dream), <sense id="n32620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild poppy</hi>, so called from its soporific qualities, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oniscus: <entryFree id="n32621" type="greek" key="o^niscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏniscus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)niskos</foreign>, <sense id="n32621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wood-louse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">milleped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:54" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8, 21, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

onoba: <entryFree id="n32624" type="main" key="Onoba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Onoba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n32624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a city in Hispania Bœtica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl> <cb n="ONUS" /></sense></entryFree>

onocentaurus: <entryFree id="n32627" type="greek" key="o^no^centaurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏcentaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)noke/ntauros</foreign>, <sense id="n32627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ass-centaur</hi>, a fabulous animal, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et occurrent daemonia onocentauris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 34, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of an impure person, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 6, 13, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onochiles: <entryFree id="n32628" type="greek" key="o^no^chi_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏchīles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏchēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏchīlon</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)noxeile/s, o)noxeili/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of bugloss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 25, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onocoetes: <entryFree id="n32629" type="greek" key="O^no^coetes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnŏcoetes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)onokoiths</foreign>, <sense id="n32629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who lies in an ass's manger</hi>, a mocking epithet applied by the heathen to Christ, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Nat. 1, 14</bibl> (al. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnŏnychītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ononuxi/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">he who has an ass's hoof</hi>, likewise applied to Christ).</sense></entryFree>

onomastus: <entryFree id="n32631" type="main" key="O^no^mastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnŏmastus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)onomasto/s, -h/</foreign>, <sense id="n32631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1144, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 751</bibl>, n. 587.</sense></entryFree>
onomatopoeia: <entryFree id="n32632" type="greek" key="o^no^ma^to^poeia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏmătŏpoeïa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)nomatopoii/+a</foreign>, <sense id="n32632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the forming of a word to resemble in sound the thing it signifies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onomatopée</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 245</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
ononis: <entryFree id="n32633" type="greek" key="o^no_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnōnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ănōnis</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)nwni/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the tall rest-harrow</hi>: Ononis antiquorum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 58, § 58</bibl> (better anonis).</sense></entryFree>
ononychites: <entryFree id="n32634" type="greek" key="O^no^ny^chi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnŏnychītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Onocoetes.</entryFree>
onopordon: <entryFree id="n32635" type="greek" key="o^no^pordon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏpordon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)no/pordon</foreign>, <sense id="n32635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">St. Mary's thistle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 86, § 110</bibl> dub.; al. ŏnŏprădon.</sense></entryFree>
onopyxos: <entryFree id="n32636" type="greek" key="o^no^pyxos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏpyxos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant of the thistle kind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onosma: <entryFree id="n32637" type="greek" key="o^nosma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnosma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/nosma</foreign>, <sense id="n32637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of</hi> anchusa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 86, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onotheras: <entryFree id="n32638" type="main" key="o^no^the_ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏthēras</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)noqhras</foreign>, <sense id="n32638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> onear, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:111:26:14:87:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 69, § 111, 26, 14, 87, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onotheris: <entryFree id="n32639" type="main" key="o^no^the_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏthēris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)noqh/ris</foreign>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnŏthūris</orth>, <sense id="n32639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the same as</hi> onotheras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onuris: <entryFree id="n32640" type="greek" key="o^nu_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnūris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/nouris</foreign>, <sense id="n32640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> oenothera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 69, § 111</bibl> (al. ŏnēar).</sense></entryFree>
onus: <entryFree id="n32641" type="main" key="o^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnus</orth> (in good MSS. also wr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŏnus</orth>), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. anas, a wagon for freight</etym>, <sense id="n32641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi> (cf. pondus). </sense><sense id="n32641.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32641.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">oneris maximi pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gravius dorso subiit onus (asellus), Hor S. 1, 9, 20: tanti oneris turris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: ad minimum redigi onus, Ov M. 14, 149.—</sense><sense id="n32641.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32641.4" n="1" level="3"> Of goods, baggage, etc., <hi rend="ital">a load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cargo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula Delos, quo omnes undique cum mercibus atque oneribus commeabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera afferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) ad onera et ad multitudinem jumentorum transportandam paulo latiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentis onera deponere,</quote> <trans><tr>loads</tr>, <tr>packs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32641.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the burden of the womb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fœtus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embryo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravidi ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:452" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 452</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 18, 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32641.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The excrements</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciborum onera reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duri ventris solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:29:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32641.7" n="II" level="1"> Trop </sense><sense id="n32641.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A burden</hi>, in respect of property, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a tax</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an expense</hi> (usually in the <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">municipium maximis oneribus pressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec onera in dites a pauperibus inclinata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerere in explicandis oneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oneribus novis turbantur provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32641.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi> of any kind (so most freq. in Cic.; cf. molestia): magni sunt oneris; <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid imponas, vehunt,</quote> <trans><tr>capable of bearing great burdens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (senectus) plerisque senibus sic odiosa est, ut onus se Aetnā gravius dicant sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus atque munus magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc onus si vos adlevabitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probandi,</quote> <trans><tr>the burden of proof</tr>, <tr>obligation to prove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 23, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oneri esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be a burden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg.</bibl> <cb n="OPAC" /> 15, 33: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eram nescius, quantis oneribus premerere susceptarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epici carminis onera lyrā sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32641.10" n="C" level="2"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">The burden</hi> of a prophecy, <hi rend="ital">the woes predicted</hi> against any one: <cit><quote lang="la">Babylonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:23:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 23, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Zach. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
onusto: <entryFree id="n32642" type="main" key="o^nusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnusto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>onustus</etym>, <sense id="n32642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load</hi> (only late Lat. and in <hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">virgo reguli partu onustanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 3</bibl></cit> in Nat. Dom. 2. Verg.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen sollicitudinibus onustatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> H. E. 10, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 15, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onustus: <entryFree id="n32643" type="main" key="o^nustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnustus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hŏnust-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>onus</etym>, <sense id="n32643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loaded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freighted</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n32643.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">asellus onustus auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 12</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">naves onustae frumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus quinque liberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna vis camelorum onusta frumenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32643.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32643.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Filled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager praedā onustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 87:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 87, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetrae telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32643.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32643.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfied</hi> with food (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">quia sum onusta mei ex sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <trans><tr>overloaded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32643.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">loaded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdened</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes exegit foras onustos fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <trans><tr>burdened</tr>, <tr>weighed down with years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onustum pectus porto laetitiā lubentiāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidicina dolis astutiisque,</quote> <trans><tr>full of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus hesternis vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carri onustissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 2:26:14" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 2, 26, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
onychintinus: <entryFree id="n32644" type="main" key="o^ny^chinti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnychintĭnus</orth>, v. onychitinus.</entryFree>
onychinus: <entryFree id="n32645" type="greek" key="o^ny^chi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnychĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)nu/xinos</foreign>. <sense id="n32645.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the color of the finger-nail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nail-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32645.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the marble called</hi> onyx: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onychinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the onyx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 39, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">resembling the onyx</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) of the coating of ice on rivers: tegimen onychinum, Laev ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnychĭna</orth> (sc. vasa), <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">vessels of onyx</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
