onychipuncta: <entryFree id="n32646" type="main" key="o^ny^chi^puncta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnychĭpuncta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> jasponyx, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl> (al. onychi juncta).</sense></entryFree>
onychitinus: <entryFree id="n32647" type="greek" key="o^ny_chi_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnȳchītĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)nuxi/tinos</foreign>, <sense id="n32647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to onyx</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">crustae (al. onychintinae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
onychitis: <entryFree id="n32648" type="greek" key="o^ny^chi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnychītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)nuxi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n32648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for</hi> onyx, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onychius: <entryFree id="n32649" type="main" key="o^ny^chi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnychĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>onyx</etym>, <sense id="n32649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to onyx</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onychius lapis, i. e. onyx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
onytes: <entryFree id="n32650" type="main" key="O^ny_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏnȳtes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Rutulian warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 514</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
onyx: <entryFree id="n32651" type="greek" key="o^nyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏnyx</orth>, <itype>ychis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/nuc</foreign> (a fingernail; hence, from its color). <sense id="n32651.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of yellowish marble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">onyx</hi>, of which vessels of many kinds were made; <cit><quote lang="la">it was also used for mlaying floors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 12, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totāque effusus in aulā Calcabatur onyx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 116</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">calcatusque tuo sub pede lucet onyx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:50:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 50, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32651.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel of onyx</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an onyx-box</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nardi parvus onyx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">murrheus,</quote> <trans><tr>an ointment-box</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 9), 22; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrio munere plenus onyx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> (3, 5), 14.— In this signif. also as <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum fuerat, quod onyx modo parva gerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:94:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 94, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32651.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A yellowish precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an onyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 24, § 90</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n32651.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The female of a mussel of the scallop species</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 32, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oonae: <entryFree id="n32652" type="main" key="Oonae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oönae</orth>, another form of Oeönae, q. v.</entryFree>
opacitas: <entryFree id="n32653" type="main" key="o^pa_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <sense id="n32653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [opacus], <hi rend="ital">shadiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shade</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">amoena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 197</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">noctium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opaco: <entryFree id="n32654" type="main" key="o^pa_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpāco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shade</hi> (class.; syn.: obscuro, obumbro). </sense><sense id="n32654.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">platanus ad opacandum hunc locum patulis est diffusa ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>, cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pinguem dives opacat Ramus humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum taxus opacat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sol terras) modo his modo illis ex partibus opacat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32654.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): opacat flore lanugo genas, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. <pb n="1267" /> <cb n="OPER" /> genas, p. 94 Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">opacat tempora pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:331" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 331</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n32654.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to darken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Eccl. Cath. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Eccl. Cath. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opacus: <entryFree id="n32655" type="main" key="o^pa_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n32655.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In the shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shady</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opaca vocantur umbrosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=185" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 185</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <trans><tr>shady coolness</tr>, <tr>cool shade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus umbrā opacior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opacissima nemorum pascua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores, qui in opaco clarius micant,</quote> <trans><tr>in the shade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 22, § 43</bibl></cit>.—So in <number>plur.</number> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per opaca locorum,</quote> <trans><tr>through shady places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 725</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 633</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32655.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32655.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Darkened</hi> as if by shades, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus Cyclopis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepuscula,</quote> <trans><tr>in the lower regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 23, 14</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n32655.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bushy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32655.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That gives</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casts a shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shady</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 851</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 438</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opalia: <entryFree id="n32656" type="main" key="O^pa_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated on the</hi> 19<hi rend="ital">th of December</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in honor of the goddess Ops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 22</bibl> Müll.; cf.: Opalia dies festi, quibus supplicatur Opi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=185" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 185</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opalis: <entryFree id="n32657" type="main" key="O^pa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. Ops</etym>, <sense id="n32657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ops</hi>: Opale sacrum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Opalia</hi> (v. Opalia), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. Fer. Rom. 15</bibl> (al. Opis ante sacrum).</sense></entryFree>
opalus: <entryFree id="n32658" type="main" key="o^pa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 21, § 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opella: <entryFree id="n32659" type="main" key="o^pella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>opera</etym>, <sense id="n32659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">light pains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opera: <entryFree id="n32660" type="main" key="o^pe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>opus</etym>, <sense id="n32660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi> (opus is used mostly of the mechanical activity of work, as that of animals, slaves, and soldiers; opera supposes a free will and desire to serve). </sense><sense id="n32660.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32660.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, quorum operae, non quorum artes emuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine hominum manu atque operā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam exigere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:174" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:57:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 57, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curamque in rebus honestis ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et laborem consumere in aliquā re,</quote> <trans><tr>to bestow labor and pains on any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiumque in res obscuras conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuere rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:31:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 31, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">68: polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: interponere, <hi rend="ital">to bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, Cic. Div. in. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:19:63" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 19, 63</bibl>: ipse dabat purpuram tantum, amici operas, <hi rend="ital">gave their work thereto</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wrought it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Verr. 2:4:26:section=59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque sunt hominum operis effecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Off. 2:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo, atque illam adducam, Quam propter opera est mihi,</quote> <trans><tr>on whose behalf I am engaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam navare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rendering of service</hi>: Cn. Pupius, qui est in operis ejus societatis, <hi rend="ital">in the service of the society</hi> or <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae forenses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Terentius, qui operas in portu et scripturā pro magistro dat,</quote> <trans><tr>serves as director</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 65, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum istud bonas edet operas,</quote> <trans><tr>will do good service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musis operas reddere,</quote> <trans><tr>to do service to</tr>, <tr>to serve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare operas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32660.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exertion</hi> bestowed on any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">deditā operā,</quote> <trans><tr>seriously</tr>, <tr>with a purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—So esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n32660.6" n="1" level="3"> Operam dare, <hi rend="ital">to bestow care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pains on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give attention to</hi> any thing.—Constr. with <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> ( = studere). </sense><sense id="n32660.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: dant operam simul auspicio augurioque, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 81 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">dare operam funeri,</quote> <trans><tr>to attend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellis, Sive foro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: liberis (<hi rend="ital">to the begetting of children</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl>: memoriae alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to attend to what brings a person to mind</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsori,</quote> <trans><tr>to get shaved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to attend to one</tr>, <tr>listen to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico,</quote> <trans><tr>to serve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: me huic dedisse operam<cb n="OPER" />  malam, <hi rend="ital">that I have done him an ill turn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 43</bibl>.—For <case>dat.</case> the <case>acc.</case> with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> occurs: <cit><quote lang="la">benigne operam detis ad nostrum gregem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">da operam, ut valeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem operam do, ut cognoscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:24:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 24, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dent operam consules, ne quid respublica detrimenti capiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego omnem operam dabo, ne pervenire ad me erubescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Polyb. 13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Polyb. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiose te operam dare, ut ne quid meorum tibi esset ignotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.10" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone: dabo operam, quoad exercitus huc summittatis, etc., Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 6</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.11" n="2" level="3"> In <case>abl.</case>: operā meā, tuā, etc., <hi rend="ital">through my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thy</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fault</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateor Abiisse eum abs te, meā operā atque astutiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi nisi malum vostra opera'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non meā operā, neque pol culpā evenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meā operā, Q. Fabi, Tarentum recepisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.12" n="3" level="3"> Unā or eādem operā, <hi rend="ital">in the same manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">unā operā mihi sunt sodales, quā iste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem operā a praetore sumam syngrapham,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.13" n="4" level="3"> Operā, <hi rend="ital">by experience</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nam te omnes saevom commemorant ... ego contra operā expertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id operā expertus sum esse ita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis non factum possum velle quam operā experiar persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.14" n="5" level="3"> Operae pretium, v. pretium, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n32660.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spare time</hi> for any thing (class., but in the phrase operae est, only ante-class. and Livian): <cit><quote lang="la">operae ubi mihi erit, ad te venero,</quote> <trans><tr>as soon as I can spare the time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si operae illi esset,</quote> <trans><tr>if he had time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam, si tibi videam esse operam, aut otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae non est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos tu operam gravare mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: de versibus, quos tibi a me scribi vis, deest mihi quidem opera, <hi rend="ital">I have not time</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.16" n="C" level="2"> In concr. </sense><sense id="n32660.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A day's work</hi> or <hi rend="ital">labor</hi> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">quaternis operis singula jugera confodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerilis una opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:44" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubulcorum operae quatuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae (filiorum) locari possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A day-laborer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">journeyman;</hi> also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a laborer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">workman</hi> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse dominus dives operis et laboris expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures operas conducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>: nona, <hi rend="ital">a ninth laborer</hi> (on his farm), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oct. 3</bibl>.—Hence, transf., in a bad sense: operae, <hi rend="ital">hired aiders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abettors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tools</hi>, etc. (of political or theatrical parties): <cit><quote lang="la">mercenariae (corresp. to multitudo conducta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erat mihi contentio cum operis conductis et ad diripiendam urbem concitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrales,</quote> <trans><tr>parties for the purpose of applauding</tr>, <tr>theatrical factions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VETERES A SCENA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 467, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32660.19" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which is wrought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a work</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae aranearum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spiders' webs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstabit opera peregrinationis hujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
operans: <entryFree id="n32661" type="main" key="o^pe^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from operor.</entryFree>
operarius: <entryFree id="n32662" type="main" key="o^pe^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>opera</etym>, <sense id="n32662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to labor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans><tr>working-cattle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>for working-men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 10, 12, § 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32662.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n32662.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a laborer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">workman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">operative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere oportet operarios quinque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: operarius rusticus, <hi rend="ital">the peasant as a day-laborer</hi>, Edict. Diocl. 7, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">operarius agrarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 37, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos singulos sicut operarios barbarosque contemnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam operarii linguā celeri et exercitatā,</quote> <trans><tr>fluent talkers</tr>, <tr>bad orators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operarium nobis quendam oratorem facis,</quote> <trans><tr>underworkman</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 62, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid actum erit, quod isti operarii minus commode persequi possent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>scribes</tr>, <tr>secretaries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32662.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a work-woman</hi>, in a comic lusus verbb., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
operatio: <entryFree id="n32663" type="main" key="o^pe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>operor</etym>, <sense id="n32663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a working</hi>, <hi rend="ital">work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">operation</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n32663.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: insidiantur aquantibus (apibus)<cb n="OPER" />  ranae, quae maxima earum est operatio, cum sobolem faciunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 24, 28, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32663.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32663.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A religious performance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">solemnity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bringing of offerings</hi>: operationes denicales, <hi rend="ital">offerings</hi>, Fest. s. v. privatae feriae, p. 242 Müll.; Inscr. a. 286, p. Chr. ap. Orell. 2234.—</sense><sense id="n32663.4" n="B" level="2"> In Christian authors, <hi rend="ital">beneficence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 573</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
operativus: <entryFree id="n32664" type="main" key="o^pe^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">creative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formative</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. 63" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
operator: <entryFree id="n32665" type="main" key="o^pe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">operator</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 3, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Castit. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 22, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
operatorius: <entryFree id="n32666" type="main" key="o^pe^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">creating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forming</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 1, 1, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fug. Saec. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
operatrix: <entryFree id="n32667" type="main" key="o^pe^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>operator</etym>, <sense id="n32667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that works</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a worker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effecter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vis operatrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia,</quote> <trans><tr>creative wisdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanc. 2, 9, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
operatus: <entryFree id="n32668" type="main" key="o^pe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. operor <sense id="n32668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
operculo: <entryFree id="n32669" type="main" key="o^percu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpercŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>operculum</etym>, <sense id="n32669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover with a lid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:30:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operculati favi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:57" default="NO">57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
operculum: <entryFree id="n32670" type="main" key="o^percu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpercŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>operio</etym>, <sense id="n32670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lid</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus operibantur operimenta et pallia opercula dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera arteria tegitur quasi quodam operculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorba in urceolos picatos adicito et opercula picata imponito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulatorium,</quote> <trans><tr>a movable cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 47, § 80</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">patellae dignum operculum,</quote> <trans><tr>like to like</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 127</bibl> (16), n. 9.—Of the covering of walls, <hi rend="ital">wainscoting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">panel-work</hi>: OPERCVLA ABIEGNIA IMPONITO, Lex Puteol. Grut. 207, col. 2.</sense></entryFree>
operimentum: <entryFree id="n32671" type="main" key="o^pe^ri_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrīmentum</orth> (sync. opermentum; <sense id="n32671.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">al. oprimentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 461</bibl></cit>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lid</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus operibantur operimenta et pallia opercula dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">operimenta decem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10</bibl></cit>: equis paria operimenta erant, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 770</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces gemino protectae operimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen, quo dolia exhauriuntur intactis operimen tis,</quote> <trans><tr>the lids</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 51, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 153</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a coverlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering for a bed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 27, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 22, 27</bibl></cit>: redditur terrae corpus et ita locatum ac situm quasi operimento matris obducitur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 56</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: operimenta animae, Ambros. Noë et Arca, 29, § 112.</sense></entryFree>
operio: <entryFree id="n32672" type="main" key="o^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ertum, 4</itype> (archaic <sense id="n32672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> operibo: ego operibo caput, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507, 33</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> operibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:12:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 12, 35</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pario, whence the opp. aperio, to uncover; cf. paro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi> any thing (class.; syn.: tego, velo, induo). </sense><sense id="n32672.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32672.2" n="A" level="2"> Operire capita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 34</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capite operto esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operiri umerum cum toto jugulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:141" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 141</bibl></cit>; id. praef. § 24.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">of clothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger multā veste operiendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 58, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 18, 7</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">fons fluctu totus operiretur, nisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summas amphoras auro et argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons nubibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rhombos) quos operit glacies Maeotica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—Comically: aliquem loris, <hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to lash soundly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias malae pugnae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operiet eos formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 3, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32672.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">claudo, praecludo, obsero): fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste opertā lecticā latus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 106</bibl></cit>: oculos, <hi rend="ital">to shut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi> (opp. patefacere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opertos compressosve (oculos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 76</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32672.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32672.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep from observation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissemble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto hoc operiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit> Bentl. (al. aperiam): <cit><quote lang="la">non in oratione operiendā sunt quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens dictu deformia operit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domestica mala tristitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32672.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <pb n="1268" /> <cb n="OPER" /> as with shame, etc. (only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliis opertus,</quote> <trans><tr>loaded</tr>, <tr>overwhelmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia operta dedecore et infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32672.7" n="3" level="3"> Of sin, <hi rend="ital">to atone for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to be forgotten</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui converti fecerit peccatorem, operiet multitudinem peccatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Pet. 4, 8.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">operta quae fuere, aperta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operta bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:16:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a secret place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a secret; an ambiguous answer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark oracle</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinis operta,</quote> <trans><tr>the dark</tr>, <tr>ambiguous oracles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telluris operta subire,</quote> <trans><tr>the depths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 140</bibl></cit>: opertum Bonae Deae, <hi rend="ital">the secret place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">secret service</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a secret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">covertly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figuratively</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">operte et symbolice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
operior: <entryFree id="n32673" type="main" key="o^pe^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrĭor</orth>, v. opperior.</entryFree>
opermentum: <entryFree id="n32674" type="main" key="o^permentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpermentum</orth>, v. operimentum <sense id="n32674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opero: <entryFree id="n32675" type="main" key="o^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, post-class. collat. form of operor, q. v.</entryFree>
operor: <entryFree id="n32676" type="main" key="o^pe^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕror</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕro</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 30, 14</bibl>), ātus, 1, <sense id="n32676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [opus], <hi rend="ital">to work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take pains; to be busied</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.).— Constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n32676.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32676.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n32676.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">seniores (apes) intus operantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi, qui operari in agro consueverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 35</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32676.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to bestow pains upon a</hi> thing; <hi rend="ital">to devote one's self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be engaged in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occupied with</hi> a thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubiis arvisque novis operari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornandis capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cute curandā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">textis Minervae, Tib 2, 1, 65: materiis caedendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scholae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditioni in scholis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 2, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus domesticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32676.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to serve the gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform sacred rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrate by sacrifices</hi> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">operam dare rebus divinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">operari est deos religiose et cum summā veneratione sacrificiis litare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 523, 9</bibl></cit>; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 523, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum Dianae sanctum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 14" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra refer Cereri laetis operatus (= sacrificans) in herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 339</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthia jam noctes est operata decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33, 2</bibl></cit> (3, 31, 2); and: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier justis operata sacris, Hor C. 3, 14, 6: sacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viditque se operatum, et sanguine sacro respersa praetexta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>. Vesta, fave: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi nunc operata resolvimus ora,</quote> <trans><tr>the mouth devoted to thee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:249" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua matutinis operatur festa lucernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32676.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32676.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be effectual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to operate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil denique praetermitteret, quod ad crudelitatem videretur operari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be effectual</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Maxim. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sui dispendium,</quote> <trans><tr>to avail</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum operatur,</quote> <trans><tr>operates</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32676.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (eccl. Lat.) </sense><sense id="n32676.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry into effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justi tiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 12, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 20, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miracula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 4, § 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32676.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce by working</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vobis sollicitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae pondus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Joan. 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n32676.11" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effectual</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">operantes apes spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 47, § 80</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonitas operantior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr. adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aridas vaporationes operantius mederi quam cataplasmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:89" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clysteres adhibere operantissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:39" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32676.12" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n32676.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">performed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effected</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tot charismata perperam operata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32676.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallaciae vis operatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
operose: <entryFree id="n32677" type="main" key="o^pe^ro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. operosus <sense id="n32677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
operositas: <entryFree id="n32678" type="main" key="o^pe^ro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>operosus</etym>, <sense id="n32678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excessive pains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overmuch nicety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elaborate workmanship</hi> (post-Aug.): est etiam, quae <foreign lang="greek">periergi/a</foreign><cb n="OPHI" />  vocatur, supervacua, ut sic dixerim, operositas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operositas suadendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitreorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
operosus: <entryFree id="n32679" type="main" key="o^pe^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>opera</etym>. <sense id="n32679.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Taking great pains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">painstaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">industrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laborious</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: laboriosus, industrius): senectus, opp. to languida atque iners,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nuce, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultibus ambae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with Gr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthia non operosa comas (al. comis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:8:52" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 8, 52</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates operose dierum,</quote> <trans><tr>in regard to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:101" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 101</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syria in hortis operosissima,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly industrious in gardening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 16, § 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32679.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a medicine, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drastic</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32679.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That costs much trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toilsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laborious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elaborate</hi> (syn. difficilis): <cit><quote lang="la">labor operosus et molestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <trans><tr>handicrafts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <trans><tr>costly</tr>, <tr>sumptuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles mundi,</quote> <trans><tr>the artfully constructed fabric of the universe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castaneae cibo,</quote> <trans><tr>hard to digest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <trans><tr>elaborate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis sepulcrum faceret operosius, quam quod decem homines effecerint triduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae operosiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrōsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n32679.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with great labor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laboriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec flat operose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl></cit>: vina condita, Ov F. 5, 269.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicemus operosius,</quote> <trans><tr>more precisely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 238</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32679.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicemus mox paulo operosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 238</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opertaneus: <entryFree id="n32680" type="main" key="o^perta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>opertus</etym>, <sense id="n32680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi> (post-Aug.): opertanea sacra, <hi rend="ital">the secret rites of the</hi> Bona Dea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 56, 77, § 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di opertanei,</quote> <trans><tr>who dwell in the bowels of the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 44</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
operte: <entryFree id="n32681" type="main" key="o^perte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. operio, <sense id="n32681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi></sense></entryFree>
opertio: <entryFree id="n32682" type="hapax" key="o^perti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>operio</etym>, <sense id="n32682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cover</hi> (for operimentum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=72" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 72</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
operto: <entryFree id="n32683" type="main" key="o^perto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏperto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opertat saepe opertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=191" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 191</bibl></cit> Müll.; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 30</bibl> (Ann. v. 500 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">continuo operta denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 75</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Ritschl, operi).</sense></entryFree>
opertorium: <entryFree id="n32684" type="main" key="o^perto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n32684.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a cover</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 36, 19</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 7, § 31; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cant. Cantic. 3, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32684.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32684.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:101:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 101, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32684.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A grave</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opertum: <entryFree id="n32685" type="main" key="o^pertum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. operio <sense id="n32685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opertus: <entryFree id="n32686" type="main" key="o^pertus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from operio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32687" type="main" key="o^pertus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpertus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>operio</etym>, <sense id="n32687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 310, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
operula: <entryFree id="n32688" type="main" key="o^pe^ru_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĕrūla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>opera</etym>, <sense id="n32688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight service</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:14:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 14, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32688.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">earnings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">operulas merere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opes: <entryFree id="n32689" type="main" key="o^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpes</orth>, <itype>opum</itype>, v. ops.</entryFree>
opetis: <entryFree id="n32690" type="main" key="opetis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opetis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> aristolochia, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophellius: <entryFree id="n32691" type="gloss" key="Ophelli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ophellĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 463, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opheltes: <entryFree id="n32692" type="main" key="O^pheltes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpheltes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ofe/lths</foreign>, <sense id="n32692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32692.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Lycurgus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:538" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 538</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32692.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan warrior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Euryalus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 201</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32692.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Etruscan seamen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 605</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32692.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Cyzicene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:198" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opheostaphyle: <entryFree id="n32693" type="main" key="o^phe^osta^phy^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĕostăphylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. ophiostaphyle.</entryFree>
ophiaca: <entryFree id="n32694" type="greek" key="O^phi^a^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭăca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *)ofiaka/</foreign>, <sense id="n32694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poems</hi> or <hi rend="ital">treatises on serpents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 96, § 258</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophias: <entryFree id="n32695" type="main" key="O_phi^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōphĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Ophius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 383</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophicardelos: <entryFree id="n32696" type="main" key="o^phi^carde_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĭcardēlos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown; perh. <hi rend="ital">a kind of onyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophici: <entryFree id="n32697" type="main" key="O^phi^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">o)/feis</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n32697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to snakes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Snake-men</hi>, an old name of the Capuans (because their territory abounded in snakes), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 730</bibl>. <cb n="OPIC" /></sense></entryFree>
ophidion: <entryFree id="n32698" type="greek" key="o^phi^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĭdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fi/dion</foreign> (little snake), <sense id="n32698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish resembling the</hi> conger, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 35, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophiogenes: <entryFree id="n32699" type="main" key="O^phi^o^ge^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭŏgĕnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ofiogenei=s</foreign>, <sense id="n32699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who cured snakebites</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 894</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:30" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 3, 6, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophiomachus: <entryFree id="n32700" type="main" key="o^phi^o^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĭŏmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fioma/xos</foreign> (<sense id="n32700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fighting with serpents</hi>); <cit><quote lang="la">hence,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of locust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ophion: <entryFree id="n32701" type="greek" key="o^phi_on1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphīon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fi/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n32701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous animal of Sardinia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 42, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:146" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 52, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32702" type="main" key="O^phi_on2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphīon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ofi/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n32702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32702.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the giants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 348</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32702.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the companions of Cadmus;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphīŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ophion;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ophionia caedes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Pentheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 483" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 483</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32702.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of Amycus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Centaur;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Ophion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Ophionide</hi>, of Amycus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 245</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
