ophiophagi: <entryFree id="n32703" type="main" key="O^phi^o^pha^gi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭŏphăgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ofiofa/goi</foreign>, <sense id="n32703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">snake-eaters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophiostaphyle: <entryFree id="n32704" type="greek" key="o^phi^osta^phy^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĭostăphylē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĕos-</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fiostafulh</foreign> (snake-grape), <sense id="n32704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of caper-bush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam id cynosbaton vocant, alii ophiostaphylen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 23, 44, § 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ophiostaphylon: <entryFree id="n32705" type="greek" key="o^phi^ostaphy^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĭostaphylon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fiosta/fulon</foreign>, i. q. vitis alba, <sense id="n32705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the white vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">white bryony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis alba est, quam Graeci ampeloleucen, alii ophiostaphylon ... appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 21</bibl></cit> (dub.; Jahn, staphylen).</sense></entryFree>
ophir: <entryFree id="n32706" type="main" key="Ophir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ophir</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> (= <foreign />), <sense id="n32706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in Southern Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 29, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ophirius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Ophir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophitae: <entryFree id="n32707" type="greek" key="O^phi_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ofi=tai</foreign>, <sense id="n32707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Snakeworshippers</hi>, a sect so called, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophites: <entryFree id="n32708" type="greek" key="o^phi_tes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fi/ths</foreign> (snakestone), <sense id="n32708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of marble spotted like a snake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpentine-stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ophites serpentium maculis similis, unde et nomen accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:158" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 22, 43, § 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 714</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32709" type="main" key="O^phi_tes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ofi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n32709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 32" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophitis: <entryFree id="n32710" type="greek" key="o^phi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fi=tis</foreign>, for 1. ophites.</entryFree>
ophiuchus: <entryFree id="n32711" type="greek" key="O^phi^u_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭūchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ofiou=xos</foreign>, <sense id="n32711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Serpent-holder</hi>, a constellation: <cit><quote lang="la">quem claro perhibent Ophiuchum nomine Graii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:42:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 42, 109</bibl></cit> ex Arat.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 331</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophiusa: <entryFree id="n32712" type="greek" key="o^phi^u_sa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĭūsa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphĭussa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fiou=sa</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">o)fiou=ssa</foreign>, <sense id="n32712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magical herb growing on the island of Elephantine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32713" type="greek" key="O^phi^u_sa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭūsa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭussa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ofiou=sa</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">-ou=ssa</foreign>) <sense id="n32713.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient name of Cyprus</hi>, whence <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭūsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Cyprian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10</bibl></cit>. 229.—</sense><sense id="n32713.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several islands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 31, 36, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 20, § 61</bibl>; 5, 32, 44, § 151.— </sense><sense id="n32713.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophiusius: <entryFree id="n32714" type="main" key="O^phi^u_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏphĭūsĭus</orth>, v. 2. Ophiusa, I.</entryFree>
ophrys: <entryFree id="n32715" type="greek" key="o^phrys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphrys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fru/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant with two leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twiblade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bifoil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 15, 93</bibl>, n. 2, § 164.</sense></entryFree>
ophthalmia: <entryFree id="n32716" type="main" key="ophthalmi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ophthalmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fqalmi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inflammation of the eye</hi>, Boëth. ex Arist. Topic. 3, p. 689.</sense></entryFree>
ophthalmias: <entryFree id="n32717" type="greek" key="o^phthalmi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphthalmĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fqalmi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n32717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi> (in pure Lat. oculata), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ophthalmicus: <entryFree id="n32718" type="greek" key="o^phthalmi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏphthalmĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)fqalmiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oculist</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:74:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 74, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opicerda: <entryFree id="n32719" type="gloss" key="o^pi^cerda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭcerda</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏvĭcerda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sheep's dung</hi>, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. sucerda, p. 302 Müll. dub.</sense></entryFree>
opicillum: <entryFree id="n32720" type="main" key="o^pi^cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭcillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ops</etym>, <sense id="n32720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little help</hi> (ante-class.): in uxorculae opicillum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 83, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opiconsiva: <entryFree id="n32721" type="gloss" key="O^pi^consi_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpĭconsīva</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpĕconsīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the festival of</hi> Ops Consivia, <hi rend="ital">celebrated on the 25th of August</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Opeconsiva dies ab deā Ope Consivia, quojus in Regiā sacrarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 21</bibl></cit> Müll.; Calend. Maff. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 396</bibl> and 311.</sense></entryFree>
opicus: <entryFree id="n32722" type="main" key="o^pi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>a fuller form for Opsus, Obscus, and Oscus, lit. Oscan; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=188" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 188</bibl> Müll.; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n32722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clownish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi> (not <pb n="1269" /> <cb n="OPIM" /> in Cic.): (Graeci) nos quoque dictitant barbaros et spurcius nos quam alios opicos appellatione foedant, M. Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 7, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nostri opici putaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <trans><tr>rough</tr>, <tr>coarse</tr>, <tr>unpolished</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:454" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 454</bibl></cit>: opici mures, <hi rend="ital">barbarians of mice</hi>, that gnaw books, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 207</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opidum: <entryFree id="n32723" type="main" key="opi^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. oppidum.</entryFree>
opifer: <entryFree id="n32724" type="main" key="o^pi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ops-fero</etym>, <sense id="n32724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aidbringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helping</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FORTVNA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1753</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 13, 24, § 64</bibl></cit>: fidem opiferam sociūm advocant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 14</bibl> (p. 109, v. 165 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
opifex: <entryFree id="n32725" type="main" key="o^pi^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭfex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>opus-facio</etym>, one who does a work. <sense id="n32725.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a worker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">framer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricator</hi> (class.; cf.: faber, artifex. operarius). </sense><sense id="n32725.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">opifex aedificatorque mundi deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum or aeternus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opifex natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sylvestres apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32725.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a workman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mechanic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artisan</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">opifices omnes in sordidā arte versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opifices atque servitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (instrumento) ego non artem credo egere, sed artificem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32725.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: dicens esse rhetoricen persuadendi opificem, id est <foreign lang="greek">peiqou=s dhmiourgo/n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mire opifex ... marem strepitum fidis intendisse Latinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opificina: <entryFree id="n32726" type="main" key="o^pi^fi^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭfĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. officina <sense id="n32726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opificium: <entryFree id="n32727" type="main" key="o^pi^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>opifex</etym>, <sense id="n32727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a working</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the doing of a work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a work</hi> (ante- and post-class), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl>: in opificiis opera, App. Flor. n. 9.</sense></entryFree>
opigena: <entryFree id="n32728" type="main" key="O^pi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Ops-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n32728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the midwife</hi>, an epithet of Juno, as the tutelar goddess of lying-in women, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Opigenam Junonem matronae colebant, quod ferre eam opem in partu laborantibus credebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=200" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 200</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
opilio: <entryFree id="n32729" type="main" key="o_pi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōpĭlĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūpĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for ovilio, from ovis</etym>, <sense id="n32729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shepherd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam opilio, qui pascit alienas oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Form upilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:60" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 38, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32729.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of bird</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=191" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 191</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
opilius: <entryFree id="n32730" type="main" key="Opi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Opĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n32730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32730.1" n="I" level="1"> Aurelius Opilius, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian and author</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32730.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another</hi> Aurelius Opilius, <hi rend="ital">a physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32730.3" n="III" level="1"> M. Opilius Severus Macrinus, <hi rend="ital">emperor of Rome</hi>, A. D. 218, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opimatus: <entryFree id="n32731" type="main" key="o^pi_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. opimo <sense id="n32731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opime: <entryFree id="n32732" type="main" key="o^pi_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. opimus <sense id="n32732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opimianus: <entryFree id="n32733" type="main" key="O^pi_mi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpīmĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Opimius, B.</entryFree>
opimitas: <entryFree id="n32734" type="main" key="o^pi_mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>opimus</etym>, <sense id="n32734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plentifulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperity</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">opimitates maximae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opimius: <entryFree id="n32735" type="main" key="O^pi_mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpīmĭus</orth> (old orthog. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpēīmĭus</orth>, Eckh. D. N. 5, p. 264), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpīmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n32735.1" n="1" level="3"> L. Opimius, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 633, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32735.2" n="2" level="3"> Q. Opimius, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 600, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 277</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Opimia,</quote> <trans><tr>a Vestal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n32735.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpī-mĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an Opimius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basilica Opimia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:32:section=156" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 32, § 156</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32735.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpīmĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an Opimius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Opimian</hi>: Opimianum vinum; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpīmĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">very celebrated wine of the vintage of</hi> A. U. C. 633, <hi rend="ital">when Opimius was consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:24" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:87:1" default="NO">9, 87, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:49:2" default="NO">10, 49, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:94" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 14, 16, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opimo: <entryFree id="n32736" type="main" key="o^pi_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>opimus</etym>, <sense id="n32736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fatten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make fat</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n32736.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">turtures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:2" default="NO">8, 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32736.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32736.3" n="1" level="3"> Of the soil, <hi rend="ital">to make fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fertilize</hi>: terram, App. de Mundo, p. 68, 6.—</sense><sense id="n32736.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To enrich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make rich</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumnum, Pomona, tuum September opimat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. de Mensib. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32736.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glorify</hi>: numina victimis, Mart. Cap. poët. 9, § 914.—</sense><sense id="n32736.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enrich</hi>, Aus. Ep. <cb n="OPIN" /> 15, 1.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">abdomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opimus: <entryFree id="n32737" type="main" key="o^pi_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ob, and obsolete pimo, to swell, make fat; akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi/wn, pimelh/</foreign>; cf. pinguis</etym>, <sense id="n32737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpulent;</hi> of a country, etc., <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n32737.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio opima et fertilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 36</bibl></cit>.—Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabulis qualis leo saevit opimis,</quote> <trans><tr>of fat cattle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:613" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 613</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra opimiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves septem opimissimos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32737.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32737.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Enriched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimus praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatio,</quote> <trans><tr>enriching</tr>, <tr>gainful</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius macrescit rebus opimis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>prosperity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera,</quote> <trans><tr>from which their spoilers enrich themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:143" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus opimum casibus,</quote> <trans><tr>rich in events</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32737.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>: dote altili atque opimā, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 72, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opima praeclaraque praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 51, 72, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma negata macrum, donata reducit opimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam exhalare opimam,</quote> <trans><tr>victorious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:281" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 281</bibl></cit>. —So esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">opima spolia,</quote> <trans><tr>the arms taken on the field of battle by the victorious from the vanquished general</tr>, <tr>the spoils of honor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice, ut insignis spoliis Marcellus opimis Ingreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 856</bibl></cit>.—Also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the arms taken from an enemy's general in single combat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 449</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=186" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 186</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">opimum belli decus,</quote> <trans><tr>honorable</tr>, <tr>high</tr>, <tr>noble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:40" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">honorable spoils</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:17" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32737.5" n="C" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">gross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overloaded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimum quoddam et tamquam adipale dictionis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindarus nimis opimā pinguique facundiā esse existimabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīmē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">richly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">instructa domus opime atque opipare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 92</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
opinabilis: <entryFree id="n32738" type="main" key="o^pi_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>opinor</etym>, <sense id="n32738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that rests on opinion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conjecture; conjectural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc omnem partem rerum opinabilem appellabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>; cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 148, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes, quae conjecturā continentur et sunt opinabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 74</bibl></cit> (opp. naturales): <cit><quote lang="la">amor (opp. naturalis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opinatio: <entryFree id="n32739" type="main" key="o^pi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supposing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opining; a supposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjecture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belief</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opinationem volunt esse imbecillam assensionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec autem opinatio est judicatio se scire, quod nesciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: mordax et inepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tullius) quid super tali opinatione sentiret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opinator: <entryFree id="n32740" type="main" key="o^pi_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n32740.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A supposer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjecturer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero ipse et magnus quidam sum opinator, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32740.1" n="II" level="1"> Under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">one who collected the tribute-corn in the provinces for the army</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 38, 11</bibl>; cf. Cod. Th. 7, 4, 26; 11, 7, 16.</sense></entryFree>
opinatus: <entryFree id="n32741" type="main" key="o^pi_na_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. opinor <sense id="n32741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32742" type="hapax" key="o^pi_na_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>opinor</etym>, <sense id="n32742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter opinatus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 465</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opinio: <entryFree id="n32743" type="main" key="o^pi_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjecture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belief</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32743.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">apud homines barbaros opinio plus valet saepe, quam res ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Scaur. 7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. Scaur. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ergo aegritudo opinio recens mali praesentis ... laetitia opinio recens boni praesentis ... metus opinio impendentis mali ... lubido opinio venturi boni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna nobis pueris opinio fuit, L. Crassum non plus attigisse doctrinae, quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut opinio mea est,</quote> <trans><tr>as I suppose</tr>, <tr>as I believe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: ut opinio mea fert, <hi rend="ital">as I believe</hi>, id. <cb n="OPIN" /> Font. 13, 39: <cit><quote lang="la">mea fert opinio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus opinionis etiam Cornelius Celsus est,</quote> <trans><tr>Celsus also is of this opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus habuit opinionem esse, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>held the belief that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:33:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 33, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuisse in illa populari opinione,</quote> <trans><tr>to be of an opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 51, 142</bibl></cit>.—More rarely: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus opinionis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eādem opinione fui ... te venturum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā me opinione sine causā esse, ne quis credat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerunt in hac opinione non pauci, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum etiam philosophi Stoicae disciplinae in eādem sint opinione, ut censeant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui opinioni nos quoque accedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse eorum opinionibus accedo, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adducere aliquem in eam opinionem, ut,</quote> <trans><tr>to make one believe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisidae in opinionem adducuntur perfugas fecisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere opinionem timoris,</quote> <trans><tr>to convey the impression</tr>, <tr>occasion the belief that one is afraid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afferre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 46</bibl></cit>: incidere in opinionem, <hi rend="ital">to fall into the belief</hi>, Dolab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in opinionem discedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to come to the opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinione duci,</quote> <trans><tr>to be led by one's belief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl></cit>: contra (praeter) opinionem, <hi rend="ital">contrary to one's expectation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere contra opiniones omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi praeter opinionem res ceciderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: opinione citius, <hi rend="ital">quicker than had been supposed</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 356, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc curavi, ut opinione illius pulcrior sis,</quote> <trans><tr>handsomer than he imagines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinione melius res tibi habet tua, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinione celerius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32743.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32743.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The repute</hi> of a man, <hi rend="ital">the esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi> in which others hold him, <hi rend="ital">the opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expectation</hi> formed of him. </sense><sense id="n32743.4" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinione fortasse nonnullā, quam de meis moribus habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integritatis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fallam opinionem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus scriptorum tuorum vicit opinionem meam,</quote> <trans><tr>exceeded my expectation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: venit in eam opinionem Cassius, ipsum finxisse bellum, <hi rend="ital">Cassius fell under suspicion of having</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was believed to have</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 2</bibl>: summam habere justitiae opinionem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum de justitiā magna esset opinio multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Porus) bellum jampridem, auditā Alexandri opinione, in adventum ejus parabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32743.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne opinio quidem et fama, cui soli serviunt (poëtae), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidi opinionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affert et ista res opinionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32743.6" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Bad repute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi> for evil: <cit><quote lang="la">malignitatis opinionem vereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae et ingrati animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32743.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divulgatā opinione tam gloriosae expeditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae opinio erat edita in vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiit opinio, proximo lustro descensurum eum ad Olympia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio etiam sine auctore exierat, eos conspirasse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem serere,</quote> <trans><tr>to spread a report</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opiniones bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 24, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 13, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opiniosus: <entryFree id="n32744" type="main" key="o^pi_ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>opinio</etym>, <sense id="n32744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set in opinion</hi> (rare): Antipater et Archidemus opiniosissimi homines, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 143</bibl> dub.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opiniuncula: <entryFree id="n32745" type="main" key="o^pi_ni^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight opinion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis opiniuncula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Avarit. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opino: <entryFree id="n32746" type="main" key="o^pi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. opinor <sense id="n32746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opinor: <entryFree id="n32747" type="main" key="o^pi_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/ssesqai</foreign>; root <foreign lang="greek">op-</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n32747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conjecture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: arbitror, reor, censeo, sentio, credo); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad opinatus sum, me in provinciam exiturum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vobis hic ordo opinatur non secus ac, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>think</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male de Caesare,</quote> <trans><tr>to have a bad opinion of</tr>, <tr>to think ill of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus gravissime de se opinans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rege durius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—Parenthet.: opinor or ut opinor, <hi rend="ital">as I think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as I believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to my opinion: Dem.</hi> Per mare <pb n="1270" /> <cb n="OPIT" /> ut vectu's, nunc oculi terram mirantur tui. <hi rend="ital">Char.</hi> Magis opinor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cepius, opinor, olim: non omnibus dormio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, opinor, quiescamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primo, ut opinor, animantium ortu petitur origo summi boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinor concedes, multo hoc esse gravius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 54</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 78</bibl>.!*? </sense><sense id="n32747.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">anteclass.</orth>): ita sapere opino esse optimum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 5</bibl> (Trag. v. 181 Vahl.); so Pac. Caecil. and Plaut. ib.—</sense><sense id="n32747.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif. as <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">supposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancied</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bona, mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 24</bibl>: interdicta est mathematicorum callida impostura, et opinatae artis persuasio, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 2, 1.—Post-class., <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinatissima insula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opinus: <entryFree id="n32748" type="main" key="o^pi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. necopinus and inopinus.</entryFree>
opipare: <entryFree id="n32749" type="main" key="o^pi^pa^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭpărē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. opiparus <sense id="n32749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opiparis: <entryFree id="n32750" type="main" key="o^pi^pa^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭpăris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. opiparus <sense id="n32750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opiparus: <entryFree id="n32751" type="main" key="o^pi^pa^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭpărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (post-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭpăris</orth>, e), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ops-paro</etym>, <sense id="n32751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">richly furnished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi> (anteand post-class.): opiparum magnarum copiarum apparatum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=188" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 188</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 37</bibl></cit>.—In the form opiparis, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭpărē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">richly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">instructa domus opime atque opipare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatum convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 162, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opis: <entryFree id="n32752" type="main" key="O_pis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ōpis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)=wpis</foreign>. <sense id="n32752.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nymph in the train of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 836</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32752.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Naiad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n32753" type="main" key="O^pis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpis</orth>, v. 2. Ops.</entryFree>
opisthodomus: <entryFree id="n32754" type="greek" key="o^pistho^do^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpisthŏdŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)pisqo/domos</foreign>, <sense id="n32754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the back part of a temple</hi> or <hi rend="ital">house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an opisthodome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 8</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
opisthographus: <entryFree id="n32755" type="greek" key="o^pisthogra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpisthogrăphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)pisqo/grafos</foreign>, <sense id="n32755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">written on the back</hi> (as, <hi rend="ital">of the paper</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">opisthographic</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">commentarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpisthogrăphum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which has been written upon on the back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testari in opisthographo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:11:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opisthotonia: <entryFree id="n32756" type="greek" key="o^pistho^to^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpisthŏtŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)pisqotoni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n32756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease in which the head is drawn backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opisthotony</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">opp. emprosthotonia, in which the head is drawn forwards,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. ad Ephes. 6, 4</bibl>; v. opisthotonos.</sense></entryFree>
opisthotonicus: <entryFree id="n32757" type="greek" key="o^pistho^to^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpisthŏtŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)pisqotoniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laboring under opisthotony</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanat opisthotonicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 75, § 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opisthotonos: <entryFree id="n32758" type="greek" key="o^pistho^to^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpisthŏtŏnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)pisqo/tonos</foreign>, <sense id="n32758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease in which the body is violently curved backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a form of lock-jaw</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 52, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 24, § 48</bibl> (written as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:3:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 3, § 3</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n32758.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disease that causes a person to fall backwards</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> 3</bibl> Ep. ad Ephes. 6, 4.</sense></entryFree>
opiter: <entryFree id="n32759" type="main" key="O^pi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpĭter</orth>, <itype>ĭtĕris and ĭtris</itype> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 695</bibl> P.; <sense id="n32759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Opetris; cf. Borghes. Framm. de' Fasti Cons. 1, p. 66), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ob-pater</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman prœnomen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Opiter est, cujus pater avo vivo mortuus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=184" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 184</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Opiter Verginius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opitergium: <entryFree id="n32760" type="main" key="O^pi^tergi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpĭtergĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n32760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Veneti</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Oderzo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n32760.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpĭtergīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Opitergium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Opitergian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŏpĭtergīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Opitergium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Opitergians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:33" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opition: <entryFree id="n32761" type="greek" key="o^pi^ti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)piti/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n32761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bulbous root used for food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of onion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opitulatio: <entryFree id="n32762" type="main" key="o^pi^tu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>opitulor</etym>, <sense id="n32762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assisting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 12. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opitulator: <entryFree id="n32763" type="main" key="o^pi^tu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtŭlātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtŭlus</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succorer</hi> (post-class.): opitulus Juppiter, et opitulator dictus est, quasi opis lator, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=184" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 184</bibl> Müll.: sodalis<cb n="OPOR" />  opitulator, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 353, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 7, 17, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opitulatus: <entryFree id="n32764" type="main" key="o^pi^tu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>opitulor</etym>, <sense id="n32764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ejus opitulatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opitulor: <entryFree id="n32765" type="main" key="o^pi^tu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (old <sense id="n32765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> opitularier; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [ops-tulo, whence tuli], <hi rend="ital">to bring aid; to help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: adjuvo, subvenio, auxilior, succurro): amanti ire opitulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum amico opitularier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiae,</quote> <trans><tr>to relieve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permultum ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentatio, quae conjecturalibus causis opitulatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 40, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32765.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be good against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to relieve;</hi> of remedies: <cit><quote lang="la">contra vanas species opitulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 103</bibl></cit>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (anteclass.): corrige, opitula, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opitulus: <entryFree id="n32766" type="gloss" key="o^pi^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. opitulator.</entryFree>
opituma: <entryFree id="n32767" type="gloss" key="o^pi^tuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭtuma</orth>, i. q. optima, Inscr.; v. bonus.</entryFree>
opium: <entryFree id="n32768" type="main" key="o^pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)/pion</foreign>, <sense id="n32768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poppyjuice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:130" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 10, 81, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opobalsametum: <entryFree id="n32769" type="main" key="o^po^balsa^me_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŏbalsămētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>opobalsamum</etym>, <sense id="n32769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place planted with balsam-trees</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">silva palmeto et opobalsameto distinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opobalsamum: <entryFree id="n32770" type="greek" key="o^po^balsa^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŏbalsămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)poba/lsamon</foreign>, <sense id="n32770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the juice of the balsam-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opobalsam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balsam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:141" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 78, § 204</bibl>.—Used for embalming bodies, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 692, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32770.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">perfume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirsuto spirant opobalsama collo Quae tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opocarpathon: <entryFree id="n32771" type="greek" key="o^po^carpa^thon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŏcarpăthon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)poka/rpaqon</foreign>, <sense id="n32771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the juice of the</hi> carpathum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 45, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opopanax: <entryFree id="n32772" type="greek" key="o^po^pa^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpŏpănax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)popa/nac</foreign>, <sense id="n32772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the juice of the herb</hi> panax, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 24, 100, § 264</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oporice: <entryFree id="n32773" type="greek" key="o^po_ri^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpōrĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)pwrikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n32773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine prepared from tree-fruits</hi> (quinces, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 79, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oporotheca: <entryFree id="n32774" type="greek" key="o^po_ro^the_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpōrŏthēca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpōrŏthēcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)pwroqh/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n32774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for keeping fruits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fruit-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitery</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:2:10" default="NO">1, 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oportet: <entryFree id="n32775" type="main" key="o^portet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏportet</orth>, <itype>ŭit, 2</itype>, <sense id="n32775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> [2. opus], <hi rend="ital">it is necessary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">needful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becoming</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">reasonable; it behooves; I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">must</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ought</hi> (cf.: opus est, necesse est, debeo; oportet denotes the necessity of reason or duty, necesse est that of compulsion).—Constr. class. with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> late Lat. also with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> tamquam ita fieri non solum oporteret, sed etiam necesse esset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:39:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 39, § 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc fieri et oportet et opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: ted ipsum oportet hoc profiteri et proloqui, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 232, 24</bibl> (Trag. v. 384 Vahl); cf.: qui alteri exitium parat, eum scire oportet sibi paratam pestem parem, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 39</bibl> (Trag. v. 22 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc scire oportet, filia tua ubi sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum hercle te esse oportet et nequam et malum,</quote> <trans><tr>you must be a truly goodfor-nothing slave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non oportuit relictas (i. e. relictas esse ancillas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescenti morem gestum oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ut erat, mansum tamen oportuit,</quote> <trans><tr>he ought to have stayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mediocre telum ad res gerendas existimare oportet benevolentiam civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia, quam his oportuit civitatibus pro frumento dari,</quote> <trans><tr>that was to be given</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:75:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 75, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde habeas, quaerit nemo, sed oportet habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:207" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 207</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex rerum cognitione efflorescat et redundet oportet oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ipsum ames oportet, non mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valeat possessor oportet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—Also (late Lat.) constr. with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 10; Boëth. Consol. Phil. 1, pros. 4.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si denique aliquid non contra ac liceret factum diceretur, sed contra atque oporteret ... est enim aliquid, quod non oporteat, etiam si licet: quicquid vero non licet, certe non oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid fiat secus quam volumus quamque oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio tempore atque oportuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longior quam oportet sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <cb n="OPPE" /> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:144" default="NO">9, 4, 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32775.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (anteclass.): ut ea, quae oportuerint, facta non sint, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 827</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec facta ab illo oportebant (al. oportebat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opos: <entryFree id="n32776" type="greek" key="o^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏpos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)po/s</foreign>, <sense id="n32776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">juice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sap</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:96" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oppallesco: <entryFree id="n32777" type="main" key="oppallesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppallesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>pallŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n32777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [ob-palleo], <hi rend="ital">to turn pale</hi> (post-class.): carnifex stupore oppalluit, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 92; Coripp. Joann. 6, 156.</sense></entryFree>
oppando: <entryFree id="n32778" type="main" key="oppando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppando</orth>, <itype>pandi, pansum, or passum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-pando</etym>, <sense id="n32778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stretch out against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad flatus helices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornibus oppansis et summā fronte coruscum (of the cross of Christ),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulaei vice oppansā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. ad Galat. 1, v. 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">oppansum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-passum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelope</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppango: <entryFree id="n32779" type="main" key="oppango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppango</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>pēgi, pactum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-pango</etym>, <sense id="n32779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fix on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to affix</hi> (anteclass. and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi savium oppegit, fugit,</quote> <trans><tr>imprinted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: repagula, quae ... ex contrario oppanguntur, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. repagula, p. 281 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oppansum: <entryFree id="n32780" type="main" key="oppansum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppansum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. oppando <sense id="n32780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oppansus: <entryFree id="n32781" type="main" key="oppansus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppansus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from oppando.</entryFree>
oppassus: <entryFree id="n32782" type="main" key="oppassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from oppando.</entryFree>
oppecto: <entryFree id="n32783" type="main" key="oppecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppecto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-pecto</etym>, <sense id="n32783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to comb off;</hi> transf., of eating, <hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pick off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio melius oppectuntur frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
