oppedo: <entryFree id="n32784" type="hapax" key="oppe_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppēdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-pedo</etym>, <sense id="n32784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break wind at</hi> any one; trop. for <hi rend="ital">to deride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curtis Judaeis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opperior: <entryFree id="n32785" type="main" key="oppe^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĕrĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>pĕrītus and pertus, 4</itype> (arch. forms, <sense id="n32785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> opperibor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:107 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 107 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> opperirier, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 51</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [kindred with experior, from perior, whence peritus]. </sense><sense id="n32785.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wait</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: exspecto, praestolor): opperiri exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=187" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 187</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pol, quamquam domi cupio, opperiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel sex mensis opperibor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quis parumper durare opperirier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ibidem opperiar, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego in Arcano opperior, dum ista cognosco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam praeterea horam ne oppertus sies,</quote> <trans><tr>wait a whole hour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.—Followed by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul opperiens, ut terrestris copiae traicerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 48, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl>; Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:3:42" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 3, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32785.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wait for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">await</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n32785.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">personal object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servom, quem ego me jusseram hic opperiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi intro: ibi me opperire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> And. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32785.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With an inanim. object: <cit><quote lang="la">seni non otium erat, id sum opperitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus dextrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to wait for the right time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:85" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppessulatus: <entryFree id="n32786" type="main" key="oppessu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppessŭlātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from the obs. oppessulo [ob-pessulus], <sense id="n32786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bolted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barred</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">januam firmiter oppessulatam pulsare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppetitus: <entryFree id="n32787" type="main" key="oppe^ti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĕtītus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from oppeto.</entryFree>
oppeto: <entryFree id="n32788" type="main" key="oppe^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĕto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>īvi and ii, ītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-peto</etym>, <sense id="n32788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go to meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to encounter</hi> (an evil, esp. death; class.; syn.: obeo, occumbo, intereo): malam pestem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 15 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">pestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>—Esp.: mortem, <hi rend="ital">to encounter death</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">to perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die</hi> (only of a violent or unnatural death), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507, 19</bibl> (Trag. v. 235 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum milites pro salute populi Romani mortem oppetiverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clarae mortes pro patriā oppetitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas superbiae,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer for one's pride</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32788.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., pregn. for oppetere mortem, <hi rend="ital">to perish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">die</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quīs ante ora patrum Trojae sub moenibus altis Contigit oppetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 268</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 543</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non senio, sed fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: gloriosā morte, <hi rend="ital">to die a glorious death</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 65.</sense></entryFree>
oppexus: <entryFree id="n32789" type="main" key="oppexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppexus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>oppecto</etym>, <sense id="n32789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="1271" /> <cb n="OPPI" /> <hi rend="ital">sombing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dressing</hi> of hair: <cit><quote lang="la">crinium regalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppico: <entryFree id="n32790" type="main" key="oppi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-pico</etym>, <sense id="n32790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smear over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seal up with pitch</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">corticem oppicato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppidaneus: <entryFree id="n32791" type="main" key="oppi^da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oppidum</etym>, <sense id="n32791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a town</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 12, 1, 38 sq.</sense></entryFree>
oppidanus: <entryFree id="n32792" type="main" key="oppi^da_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭdānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in a town</hi> other than Rome (since urbanus signifies, of Rome, from the capital); sometimes in a depreciating sense, opp. to urbanus, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a small town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provincial</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">senex quidam oppidanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidanum et inconditum genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lascivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭdānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a townsman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidani domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭdāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of a town</hi> other than Rome, <hi rend="ital">townsmen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">townsfolk</hi> (esp. when besieged), <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. G 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>; 58; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oppidatim: <entryFree id="n32793" type="main" key="oppi^da_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭdātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by towns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the towns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every town</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludos oppidatim constituerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum oppidatim victimae caederentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppido: <entryFree id="n32794" type="main" key="oppi^do_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭdō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. <foreign lang="greek">e)/mpedon</foreign>; v. oppidum</etym>, <sense id="n32794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi> (already obs. in the time of Quint.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido sunt usi paululum tempore nostro superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 25</bibl></cit>. Confined altogether to familiar discourse; <cit><quote lang="la">we meet with no example of oppido in Cicero's orations): oppido, valde multum. Ortum est autem hoc verbum ex sermone inter se confabulantium, quantum quisque frugum faceret, utque multitudo significaretur, saepe respondebatur, Quantum vel oppido satis esset. Hinc in consuetudinem venit, ut diceretur oppido pro valde multum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=184" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 184</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido interii,</quote> <trans><tr>I am completely done for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratus,</quote> <trans><tr>greatly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm, 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridiculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se differunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens, Liv 42, 28, 13: perambula aedīs oppido tamquam tuas,</quote> <trans><tr>just as if they were</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 122</bibl></cit>.—Also, as an affirmative reply to a question: <cit><quote lang="la">Omnene? Oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—In a lusus verbb. with oppidum: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum a me toto oppido et quidem oppido quaesitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 326</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:35:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 35, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido quam,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido quam breve intervallum, Liv 36, 25, 3: oppido quam parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:39:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 47, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppidulum: <entryFree id="n32795" type="main" key="oppi^du^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭdŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>oppidum</etym>, <sense id="n32795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansuri oppidulo, quod versu dicere non est (viz Equus Tuticus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppidum: <entryFree id="n32796" type="main" key="oppi^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n32796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur</hi> oppidūm, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>; old <hi rend="ital">abl plur.</hi> oppedeis, Lex. Servil.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ob and pedum; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pe/don</foreign>; Sanscr pada-m, on or over the plain</etym>. </sense><sense id="n32796.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town</hi> (of towns other than Rome, which was called Urbs; <cit><quote lang="la">though occasionally the term oppidum was applied to Rome) (class.): oppidum ab opi dictum, quod munitur opis causā, ubi sit: et quod opus est ad vitam gerundam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=141" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 141</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=202" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi coetus (hominum) sedem primum certo loco domiciliorum causā constituerunt, quam cum locis manuque saepsissent, ejusmodi conjunctionem tectorum oppidum vel urbem appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>: Athenas anticum opulentum oppidum Contempla, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 5</bibl> (Trag. v. 324 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fortunatum oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Segesta est oppidum pervetus in Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia in oppidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, B, § <cit><quote lang="la">1: Romana per oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbe (i.e. Romā) oppidove ullo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl></cit>.—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, of name of a town: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">Rome</hi>: per totum oppidum, <hi rend="ital">all through the town</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">14 Müll.: eos (legatos) in oppidum intromitti non placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum Martis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.—In like manner oppidum denotes <hi rend="ital">Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 2</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pel. 1, 2</bibl>.—In a fig. of an old man: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc ego oppidum vetus continuo legiones meas Protinus adducam: hoc si expugno, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32796.2" n="B" level="2"> <cb n="OPPO" /> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of a town</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic oppida tota canem venerantur, nemo Dianam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32796.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fortified wood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forest</hi>, among the Britons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 21</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n32796.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The barriers</hi> of the circus (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Circo primo unde mittuntur equi, nunc dicuntur carceres, Naevius oppidum appellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=184" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 184</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
oppignerator: <entryFree id="n32797" type="main" key="oppigne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppignĕrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>oppignero</etym>, <sense id="n32797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who takes a pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who lends on a pledge</hi>, (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 215" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 215</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oppignero: <entryFree id="n32798" type="main" key="oppigne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppignĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-pignero</etym>, <sense id="n32798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give as a pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pawn</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n32798.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli pro vino etiam saepe oppignerabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 51, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:57:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 57, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32798.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: filiam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo se oppignerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppilatio: <entryFree id="n32799" type="main" key="oppi_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppīlātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oppilo</etym>, <sense id="n32799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stopping up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstructing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">narium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 47" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppilo: <entryFree id="n32800" type="main" key="oppi_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppīlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obpilo</etym>, <sense id="n32800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut up</hi> (rare but class; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: obturo, obstruo, claudo): metretam novam amurcā colluito, oppilato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:31:135" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 31, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalis tabernae oppilatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausae portae et oppilatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 7, 3.</sense></entryFree>
oppingo: <entryFree id="n32801" type="main" key="oppingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppingo</orth>, v. oppango.</entryFree>
oppius: <entryFree id="n32802" type="main" key="Oppi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Oppĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oppĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n32802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n32802.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Oppius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n32802.2" n="2" level="3"> L. Oppius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman knight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 13, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32802.3" n="3" level="3"> P. Oppius, <hi rend="ital">a quœstor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defended by Cicero;</hi> v. the fragm. in Orell. p. 444.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oppia,</quote> <trans><tr>the wife of L. Mindius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; v. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:220" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 220</bibl> Jan.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:322" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 322</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Oppĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an Oppius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Oppian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oppia lex,</quote> <trans><tr>proposed by the people's tribune</tr>, <tr>C. Oppius</tr>, <tr>against women's extravagance in dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oppius mons,</quote> <trans><tr>one of the summits of the Esquiline Hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 50</bibl></cit> Müll.; Fest. s. v. septimontium, pp. 340 and 348 Müll.; cf. Becker's Antiq. 1, pp. 521, 534.</sense></entryFree>
oppleo: <entryFree id="n32803" type="main" key="opple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opplĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ēvi, ētum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obpleo, plenus</etym>, <sense id="n32803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32803.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: saucii opplent porticūs, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 16 Vahl.): ager oppletus imbrium fremitu, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 196 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">oppleta tritici granaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis spoliis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives jam omnia oppleverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32803.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienus odor nares opplet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32803.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam opplebit auris meas sua vaniloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec opinio Graeciam opplevit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D. 2, 24, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes angustae, oppletae tenebris ac sordibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppletus: <entryFree id="n32804" type="main" key="opple_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opplētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from oppleo.</entryFree>
opploro: <entryFree id="n32805" type="hapax" key="opplo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opplōro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>ob-ploro</etym>, <sense id="n32805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wail at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> any thing: auribus meis, Auct. Her 4, 52, 65.</sense></entryFree>
oppono: <entryFree id="n32806" type="main" key="oppo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppōno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>pŏsŭi</itype> (in Plaut pŏsīvi), sĭtum, 3 (<sense id="n32806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sync.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppostus for oppositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 150</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-pono</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">station before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose</hi> (class., cf.: obicio, offero, adversor). </sense><sense id="n32806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32806.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">se venientibus in itinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. C 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic equites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim ad introitum portūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: armatos homines ad omnes introitus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eumenem adversariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: (Hannibali) opposuit natura Alpemque nivemque, Juv 10, 152.—<hi rend="ital">To place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos opposuit manum, Ov F. 4, 178: oculis manūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum fronti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:M. 2:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae se opponant (pullis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramini oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep before the opening</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos opponi omnibus contionibus auctores ad perniciem meam,</quote> <trans><tr>represented</tr>, <tr>held up as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 19, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet antestari? ego vero Oppono auriculam,</quote> <trans><tr>offer</tr>, <tr>present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppositas habere fores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>closed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 8</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">To apply</hi>, as a remedy: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32806.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to set against</hi> as a pledge, <hi rend="ital">to pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortgage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pono pallium: ille suum anulum opposivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: potes mutuam drachumam me dare? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Vix hercle opino, etsi me opponam pignori, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 84</bibl>: ager oppositus<cb n="OPPO" />  est, pignori ob decem minas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Esdr. 5, 3.—So, with a play upon both meanings: <cit><quote lang="la">villula nostra non ad Austri flatus opposita est, verum ad milia quindecim,</quote> <trans><tr>mortgaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:26:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 26, 1 sq.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n32806.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To expose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay bare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opponere se periculis pro re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saguntinis pro nudatā moenibus patriā corpora opponentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudatas radices hiberno frigori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 262</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32806.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32806.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to set before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set before the eyes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allege</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula intendantur, formidines opponantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante occupet (orator), quod videat opponi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 40, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:24:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 24, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem suam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his quattuor causis totidem medicinae opponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opposuisti semel Ciceronis nostri valetudinem: conticui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl></cit> (10), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">muri causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32806.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32806.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To speak against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adduce in contradiction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opponas, si negem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non minorem auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis opposuit sese Socrates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habes quod mihi opponas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut opponeret Stoicis, summum bonum esse frui iis rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32806.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, by way of comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">multis secundis proeliis unum adversum, et id mediocre, opponerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:Epil. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> Epil. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationibus labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens quis dixerit, occidit Alexander Persarum multa milia, opponetur et Callisthenem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:23:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 117, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:118:8" default="NO">118, 8</bibl> sq.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">felicia tempora, quae te Moribus opponunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32806.10" n="C" level="2"> Jusjurandum alicui, <hi rend="ital">to impose an oath on one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 6</bibl>.—Hence. <orth extent="full" lang="la">oppŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">standing against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying over against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">moles oppositae fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna opposita soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppositam petens contra Zancleia saxa Rhegion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 47</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Narbo propugnaculum istis ipsis nationibus oppositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32806.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">oppŏsĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">contradictory propositions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposites</hi> (postclass.): opposita (<foreign lang="greek">a)ntikei/mena</foreign> Graeci dicunt), Geil. 16, 8, 13.</sense></entryFree>
opporto: <entryFree id="n32807" type="gloss" key="opporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opporto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n32807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portat, subportat, obportat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opportune: <entryFree id="n32808" type="main" key="opportu_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opportūnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. opportunus <sense id="n32808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
opportunitas: <entryFree id="n32809" type="main" key="opportu_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opportūnĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>opportunus</etym>. <sense id="n32809.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">fitness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitableness</hi> (class.; syn. occasio; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copia, facultas): loci,</quote> <trans><tr>local advantages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N D. 1, 33, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32809.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32809.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportune</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">favorable time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a favorable opportunity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimā opportunitate ambo autem venistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia opportunitatis idoneorum ad agendum temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni negotio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—Personified as <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Opportunity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32809.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An advantage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales igitur inter viros amicitia tantas opportunitates habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>. opportunitate aliquā datā, <hi rend="ital">if some advantage offered itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opportunus: <entryFree id="n32810" type="main" key="opportu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opportūnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obportus, lit., at or before the port; hence</etym>, <sense id="n32810.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convenient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportune</hi> (class.; syn.: commodus, utilis): tempus actionis opportunum, Graece <foreign lang="greek">eu)kairia</foreign>, Latine appellatur occasio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas opportunissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil opportunius accidere vidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">op-portūna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">convenient things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum opportuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32810.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n32810.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Advantageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterae res, quae expetuntur, opportunae sunt singulae rebus singulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32810.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted</hi> to any thing: ad omnia haec magis opportunus nemo est, Ter Eun. 5, 8, 47.—</sense><sense id="n32810.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liable</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus cedentem hostem effuse sequendo opportunus huic eruptioni fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportuniora morbis corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 68</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">opportūnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasonably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunely</hi><pb n="1272" /> <cb n="OPPR" />  (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus opportune captus ad eam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportune, importune,</quote> <trans><tr>in season and out of season</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportunius alio loco referemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:97" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 97</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiis opportunissime allatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oppositio: <entryFree id="n32811" type="main" key="oppo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppŏsĭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oppono</etym>, <sense id="n32811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opposing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposition</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">disparatum est id, quod ab aliquā re per oppositionem negationis separatur, hoc modo: sapere, et non sapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppositus: <entryFree id="n32812" type="main" key="oppo^si^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from oppono.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32813" type="main" key="oppo^si^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (in <number>sing.</number> used only in <case>abl.</case>) [oppono]. <sense id="n32813.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A placing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">setting against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an opposing;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">obj.-gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum nostrorum oppositus et corporum pollicemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 10, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:212" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 212</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">subj.-gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32813.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A placing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laying before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an interposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppositu globi noctem afferente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 71, 73, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32813.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A citing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bringing forward against</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">oppositu horum vocabulorum commotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppressio: <entryFree id="n32814" type="main" key="oppressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppressĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>opprimo</etym>. <sense id="n32814.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pressing down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl>; trop., <hi rend="ital">force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 30</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n32814.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Violent seizure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupatio fori, oppressio curiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32814.2" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Oppression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum et libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32814.3" n="4" level="3"> (Late Lat.) Med. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhyis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a catalepsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10:56" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:5:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 5, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oppressiuncula: <entryFree id="n32815" type="main" key="oppressi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppressĭuncŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>oppressio</etym>, <sense id="n32815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight pressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle pressure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">papillarum horridularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppressor: <entryFree id="n32816" type="hapax" key="oppressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppressor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>opprimo</etym>, <sense id="n32816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crusher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyer</hi>: oppressores dominationis, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oppressus: <entryFree id="n32817" type="main" key="oppressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppressus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from opprimo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32818" type="main" key="oppressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppressus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>opprimo</etym>, <sense id="n32818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">in oppressu valido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 851</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opprimo: <entryFree id="n32819" type="main" key="oppri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opprĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>essi, essum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-premo</etym>, <sense id="n32819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press together; to press down</hi> (class.; syn. obruo). </sense><sense id="n32819.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluit deus ora loquentis Opprimere,</quote> <trans><tr>to close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 295</bibl></cit>: oculos, <hi rend="ital">to press together</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">close the eyes</hi>, sc. of a dying person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>: flammam in ore, <hi rend="ital">to repress</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 122</bibl> (Trag. v. 437 Vahl.).— <hi rend="ital">To press down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleam pede,</quote> <trans><tr>to press into the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprimi ruinā conclavis,</quote> <trans><tr>to be crushed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā oppressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <trans><tr>to sink</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem injectu multae vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>to smother</tr>, <tr>stifle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dormiens oppressit eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32819.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppressit jaculo redeuntem ad frena leonem,</quote> <trans><tr>struck down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:24" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n32819.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32819.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To press together; to close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os opprime,</quote> <trans><tr>shut your mouth! hold your tongue!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32819.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bear down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprimi onere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32819.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae oratio a censore opprimenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine tumultu rem omnem oppressere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem,</quote> <trans><tr>to baffle</tr>, <tr>thwart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 24, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32819.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overpower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias hujus belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam acerbitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to put an end to</tr>, <tr>destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exstinctae potius amicitiae, quam oppressae esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem iniquo judicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerandam potentiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to overthrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to crush one</hi> with false accusations, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insontem oblato falso crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si oppressa foret secura senectus (i. e. securus senex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:75" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter indistinctly</tr>, <tr>to mumble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 133</bibl></cit>.—In gen., <hi rend="ital">to have the upper hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get the best of it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be victorious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n32819.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcome</hi>: opprimi<cb n="OPPU" />  aere alieno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mvidiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius corporis doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus oppressus et afflictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32819.9" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surprise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take by surprise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come upon unexpectedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catch</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">adorior, invado): occasionem opprimere,</quote> <trans><tr>to seize</tr>, <tr>embrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprudentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incautos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonium mors oppressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:91:section=213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne subito a me opprimantur (sc. interrogando),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 67</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">150: oppressi luce copias instruunt, Auct. B. G. 8, 14: rostra,</quote> <trans><tr>to make one's self master of</tr>, <tr>occupy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 40, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32819.10" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quo studiosius ab ipsis opprimitur et absconditur, eo magis eminet et apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 72, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ejus rei oppressa mentio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n32819.11" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To force</hi> a woman, <hi rend="ital">commit a rape upon</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 13, 12</bibl>; 14, 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 34, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
opprobramentum: <entryFree id="n32820" type="main" key="oppro_^bra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opprō^brāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>opprobro</etym>, <sense id="n32820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opprobramentum, aut flagitium muliebre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 84</bibl></cit> (420 Ritschl).</sense></entryFree>
opprobratio: <entryFree id="n32821" type="main" key="oppro_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opprō^brātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reproaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upbraiding</hi>, (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opprobratione permotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opprobriosus: <entryFree id="n32822" type="main" key="oppro_^bri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opprō^brĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n32822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [opprobrium], <hi rend="ital">opprobrious</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 41</bibl>; Ambros. Cain et Abel, 1, 4, 14.</sense></entryFree>
opprobrium: <entryFree id="n32823" type="main" key="oppro_^bri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opprō^brĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), i. <gen>n.</gen> <etym>opprobro</etym>, <sense id="n32823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scandal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opprobrium</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: dedecus, probrum, infamia). vereor, ne civitati meae sit opprobrio, si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>lest it should be a reproach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et turpitudo generis opprobrio multis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprobria culpae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32823.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n32823.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abusive word</hi> or <hi rend="ital">language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morderi opprobriis falsis, Hor Ep. 1, 16, 38: fundere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 758</bibl></cit>; Inscr. Lanuv. (133 B. C.) ap. Mommsen de Collegiis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n32823.3" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">a reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi> (like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/legxos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">o)/neidos</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">opprobria Romuli Remique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cecropiae domus aeternum opprobrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opprobro: <entryFree id="n32824" type="main" key="oppro_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">opprō^bro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), no <sense id="n32824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-probrum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upbraid</hi> (ante- and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: vitupero, objurgo, reprehendo): opprobrare, probrum obicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=187" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 187</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">egone id exprobrem, qui mihimet cupio id opprobrarier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollities cuidam opprobrata acerbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oppugnantia: <entryFree id="n32825" type="main" key="oppugnanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppugnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oppugno</etym>, <sense id="n32825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposition</hi> (late Lat.), Dion. Exig Epist. de Rat. Paschae, p. 513 M.</sense></entryFree>
oppugnatio: <entryFree id="n32826" type="main" key="oppugna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppugnātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a storming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assaulting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besieging; an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">siege</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32826.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de oppidorum oppugnationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnatio Gallorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>their method of besieging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propulsare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquere,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnatione civitas cingitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32826.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> with words, <hi rend="ital">an accusation</hi>, etc.: totum genus oppugnationis hujus propulsare debetis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine oppugnatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppugnator: <entryFree id="n32827" type="main" key="oppugna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppugnātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n32827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assaulter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attacker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assailant</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n32827.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnatores, opp. obsessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32827.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 31, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oppugnatorius: <entryFree id="n32828" type="main" key="oppugna_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppugnātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oppugnator</etym>, <sense id="n32828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a siege</hi> (only in Vitr.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oppugno: <entryFree id="n32829" type="main" key="oppugno1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppugno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (old <sense id="n32829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. fut.</hi> oppugnassere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 55</bibl>; v. Roby, Gram. 1, 197 sq.), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obpugno</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fight against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besiege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">war with</hi> (class.; cf.: obsideo, occupo). </sense><sense id="n32829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Galliae civitates ad se oppugnandum venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggeribus, vineis, turribus oppugnabam oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 4, 6</bibl>: castra,<cb n="OPS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21</bibl></cit>: clamor oppugnantis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 408 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">castelli oppugnandi spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Macedoniam oppugnaturum dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnante aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:5:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam externo hoste oppugnarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Methonam urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">25, 4, 7: nos et civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 11, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n32829.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non oportuisse Metellum, patrem tuum, oppugnari a me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniā aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem clandestinis consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 66, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitatem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay siege to</tr>, <tr>circumvent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: sonipes celer ... Oppugnat frenis, <hi rend="ital">struggles against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resists</hi>, Coripp. Joann. 4, 468.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n32830" type="main" key="oppugno2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppugno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), no <sense id="n32830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-pugnus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to beat with fists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to buffet</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
opputo: <entryFree id="n32831" type="main" key="oppu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oppŭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">obp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-puto</etym>, <sense id="n32831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prune</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
